description:
**Join Bob’s Sales Team: Enhance Shopping Experiences, Grow Your Career!**

Looking for a workplace that offers more than just a job? At Bob’s, we understand you have choices, which is why we're committed to providing exceptional opportunities for career growth alongside a vibrant and team-oriented environment with fantastic benefits! Let us introduce you to the exciting world of Bob’s where you're not just a Sales Associate; you're a Guest Experience Specialist.

**What We Offer:**

**Career Growth**: Opportunity isn't just a buzzword here. We're dedicated to nurturing your professional development journey.

**Team-Oriented Environment**: Join a fun and supportive team that champions collaboration and positivity.

**Great Benefits:** From health and wellness to financial planning tools, we've got your well-being covered.

**About the Role:**

As a Bob’s Sales Specialist, you'll be at the forefront of elevating our guests' shopping experiences across all channels. Whether they're in-store, utilizing our associate-assisted sales channels, or browsing through our digital platforms, you'll ensure a fair, professional, and seamless omnichannel experience.

**Why Choose Bob’s:**

**The Bob’s Way:** We believe in honest, gimmick-free service that prioritizes customer satisfaction above all else.

**Cutting-Edge Training**: Our robust sales training program combines virtual and in-store sessions, ensuring you're equipped with the skills for success.

**State-of-the-Art Technology:** Utilize the latest tools and resources, from inventory management to augmented reality scanning apps, to enhance customer interactions and boost sales.

**Total Rewards Program:**

Our benefits go beyond just earnings and incentives. Enjoy comprehensive health and wellness packages, paid time off, employee discounts, and more. We're committed to supporting your well-being both at work and at home.

**Diversity and Inclusion:**

We celebrate diversity and value the unique perspectives and talents each individual brings to our team. We're dedicated to fostering an inclusive environment where everyone can thrive and grow.

**Ready to Join Us?**

Don't just take our word for it. Hear what our employees have to say on GlassDoor, and when you're ready to take the leap, hit that apply button!

Are you ready for the last interview you'll ever have? Join us at Bob’s and let's make a difference together!

title: Assistant Store Manager
description:
**Assistant Store Manager in Venchi NYC Stores** 

**Starting Salary:**  $62,500 (annually)

Are you an ambitious leader who wants to be a direct part of a rapidly growing international company? Now is the time to join our team! We are an Italian-based chocolate and gelato company, founded in 1878, with over 150 stores located across the US, the UK, Italy, and many other countries.

We are looking for driven individuals to lead our stores as we continue to expand into new locations across the US.

**Benefits:** Competitive industry medical, PTO, and 401K.

**Key Responsibilities**

* Support Store Manager having planned and well-structured follow-ups and coaching sessions with all team members
* Drive sales through a high standard of customer service and business acumen
* Be a brand champion by promoting the 'Venchi Service Model'
* Support the store manager to drive the store's KPIs goals and results.
* Support all employees in their training, acting as a guide and motivator while continuously teaching and developing
* Support Manager in leading team in achieving company objectives.
* Benchmark regularly against similar and high-performing stores to identify opportunities.
* Ensure standards and procedures are met through a successful Store Operational Audit.
* Keep all equipment well maintained and report any issues.
* Maintain food and safety regulations.

**Assistant Store Manager Role Requirements:**

* One year of Assistant Store Manager experience
* Experience in running a fast-paced retail sales and customer service environment.
* Working experience in the food industry is preferred.
* Passionate about chocolate and gelato.
* Fluent in English, bilingual is a plus.
* Flexibility in work schedule is required including the ability to work extended hours, weekends, and holidays as needed.
* Comfortable working evenings and weekends, that’s when we are at our busiest!
* Ability to work a retail schedule, including nights, weekends, and holidays, …and obviously a chocolate and gelato lover!

title: Marketing and Communications Internship
description:
Need a Spring 2025 Internship? Apply Now!

USA Sport Group is at the forefront of providing high-quality sports enrichment programs to over 60,000 children annually. With classes and camps taking place in over 400 towns across NY, NJ & CT including preschool sports, soccer, tennis, basketball, t-ball, and more, we are always on the lookout for great people to join our team.

As a USA Sport Group Intern, you will gain hands-on work experience at an exciting, fast-paced, sports company. USA Sport Group internships can provide you with college course credits (depending on school requirements), or simply provide necessary work experience to prepare you for your future career.

The Marketing & Communications Internship is designed for currently enrolled students who are interested in advertising and promoting youth sports programs. Students will gain knowledge and experience in advertising campaigns, email marketing, social media marketing, SEO, content creation, graphic design, community outreach, grassroots marketing and more. This position is ideal for students currently studying or seeking a career in marketing, advertising, public relations, communications, graphic design, or digital/ social media.

You will work under the guidance of our Marketing Coordinator and/or Program Managers to implement both our online and traditional marketing initiatives. You will have the opportunity to contribute new ideas for marketing campaigns, in particular drafting and sending email marketing communications and assisting with the creation and posting of social media content.

Part of your experience will be to build and develop relationships with local businesses that can help assist in promoting and marketing our programs to their community. At times you may also be required to deliver and distribute company product information to potential customers off-site.

Other responsibilities may include but are not limited to:

* Researching new marketing avenues – including information on cost-per-click, demographics, etc.
* Designing & creating literature, posters, advertisements, and online promotional materials
* Collecting & analyzing data from marketing campaigns.
* Call and email customers and/or local businesses
* Assist customers with their registration via phone and live chat.

Does this sound like you?

* Knowledge & understanding of different marketing strategies
* High energy and desire to successfully manage various projects
* Experience using graphic design software (desirable, not required)
* Ability to deliver company philosophy and uphold customer service standards
* Clear and friendly phone manner
* Computer literate - especially Microsoft Office programs including Excel and Outlook
* Ability to multi-task in a pressurized environment
* Good communication skills both verbally and in written
* An interest or passion for sports

Flexible Internships Available

* Base internship of 15 hours per week
* Internships will be fully onsite in Whitehouse Station, NJ
* Customizable hours based around your studies
* Customizable to earn course credits

Job Type: Internship

Pay: $10.00 per day

Benefits:

* Flexible schedule

Schedule:

* Choose your own hours

Work Location: On the road
company_description: USG is always looking to add talented sports coaches to the existed staff base. Make a difference in the lives of children & join USG Today!

title: Mortgage Collections Rep
description:
Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
* Communicate daily with borrowers who are delinquent on loan payments, generally by incoming and outgoing telephone conversations but also by letters and email. Document efforts - results in the collection notepad system.
* Process incoming and outgoing documents related to collection and loss mitigation efforts.
* Update telephone numbers, address and related information as warranted to the core system.
* Explore alternative means to assist customer in bringing the loan current (e.g., Forbearance plans, Repayment plans, Modification, etc. and refer borrower to the Loss Mitigation Department as warranted.
* Trouble shoot to resolve customer issues.
* Develop and maintain effective working relationships with attorneys, insurance agents and realtors as well as internal departments (e.g., Customer Service, Escrow, Payment processing, Post-closing, Documentation, Valley branches, HLCs, etc.).
* Maintain full compliance with all Regulatory and GSE requirements as well as the Bank's policies and procedures.

Requirements:
**Required Skills:*** Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability with handle difficult customers.
* Strong math skills with the ability to calculate figures.
* Strong analytical skills and detail oriented.
* Self-motivated and able to handle multiple priorities.
* Basic knowledge of Microsoft Office.

**Required Experience:*** High School diploma or GED and a minimum of one year collection or call center experience.
* Minimum of 2 Years collection experience with a mortgage background preferred.
company_description: If you think working in banking can’t be exciting, think again. The financial industry is undergoing a digital transformation, which makes this a great time to embark on a career at Valley.

title: Experienced Aesthetic Injector, RN/NP/PA (Flatiron)
description:
**About Us**



Alchemy 43, a fast-growing aesthetics brand, offers specialized, innovative, and technology-driven services in an elevated setting. With a focus on beauty, wellness and empowering confidence, Alchemy 43 delivers the highest quality in medical aesthetics—all within an exceptional customer focused environment.

  

With locations in Los Angeles, Orange County, New York City, and Texas Alchemy 43 has re-imagined the cosmetic injectables experience—taking it from a tedious medical procedure to a luxurious, selfcare ritual. Future plans include a skincare product line and national expansion into multiple new markets this year and beyond.

 **Role Overview**



This cosmetic injector role will be to deliver a comprehensive experience for the client, anticipating every aspect of the needs of the client from the moment they bring the client into the treatment room. The role of our injectors will be to follow the brand driven customer service training and injector training to provide a truly unique experience to each and every client. The end goals of amazing outcomes, consistency, and an elevated level of service will be achieved utilizing the process of assessment using the Canfield Vectra software, diagnosis, collaboration with client on treatment goals, the treatment itself, post-treatment monitoring and evaluation under the supervision of the Medical Director.

**Alchemy Location: 40 E 21st St, New York, NY 10010**

 **Responsibilities**


* Deliver best in class cosmetic injectable treatments following the guidelines and under the supervision of the Medical Director
* Conduct client consults and treatment plans
* Leverage resources and tools provided by Alchemy 43 to enhance adoption of the Alchemy 43 branded experience
* Educate clients on all offerings of Alchemy 43 via the client engagement script
* Cross-sell procedures and products that compliment the treatment and enhance the result
* Synergistically work with Alchemy 43 management, ownership, injectors, and support team
* Comply with required protocols, requests, and compliance policies
* Effectively utilize all IT systems to include but not limited to Canfield Imaging Software, Patient EMR, client engagement software and all other equipment

  


**Requirements**


* **Must have a** **m****inimum of 1-2 years** **of active relevant aesthetic Injectable experience** (ie: Botox, Dysport, Juvederm, & Restylane products) that is **unsupervised, in a clinical and/or med-spa setting.**
* Proficient in FDA approved cosmetic neurotoxins and all FDA approved Allergan dermal fillers
* Must be able to work a **flexible schedule including evenings and Saturdays**
* Up-to-date New York RN, NP, or PA license
* Proficiency with patient EMR, charting, Word, Excel, and other software skills
* Hold a high level of professionalism when interacting with clients, and staff members
* Open to learning new techniques and procedures and brand language
* Cheerful upbeat demeanor and can-do attitude
* Detail-oriented
* Excellent customer service and consultative skills
* Proven selling skills
* Strong business acumen
* Strong conflict and problem resolution skills
* Experience discussing pricing program with clients
* Understanding of social media

  


**Pay:** **$150,000.00 - $275,000.00 per year (hourly pay plus uncapped bonus potential)**

 **Benefits**


* Health insurance (min 20 hours per week)
* Dental insurance (min 20 hours per week)
* Vision insurance (min 20 hours per week)
* Paid time off (min 20 hours per week)
* Paid holidays (min 30 hours per week)
* Paid quarterly advanced injector training
* On-going education on new techniques and products
* Quarterly complementary procedures/products
* Employee/friends/family discounts
* Career advancement opportunities

  


**Supplemental pay types:**Uncapped bonus potential



Alchemy 43 offers competitive Aesthetic Injector pay. We focus on continued growth and development by providing opportunities for on-going education on new techniques and products.

 **Equal Opportunity Employer**



Alchemy 43 is an equal opportunity employer. Applicants are considered for all roles without regard to race, color, religious creed, sex, national origin, citizenship status, age, physical or mental disability, sexual orientation, marital, parental, veteran, or military status, unfavorable military discharge, or any other status protected by applicable federal, state, or local law. The Employer retains the right to change or assign other duties to this position. Job description doesn't constitute a contract of employment and that the company may exercise its employment-at-will rights at any time.

description:
**Job Summary:**

To provide clinical treatment services to foster children and parents as part of the foster care service plan focused on addressing mental health issues.

**Duties/Responsibilities:** 

* Provide individual and group therapy and psychiatric supports to children and adolescents by utilizing interventions from evidence-based psychotherapeutic methodology.
* Provide collateral sessions with the caretaker and/or birth parent as needed to enhance treatment.
* Conducts assessments for children to assess the need for mental health treatment.
* Establish treatment goals for children, utilizing historical and current available information in collaboration with multidisciplinary team.
* Participate in FTCs and monthly clinical team conferences.
* Communicate with the family, Foster Care department, Health Services department and Health Home Care Management department to enhance client compliance and integration of services.
* Participate in weekly individual supervision and monthly group supervision.
* Attends all required trainings to enhance skills working with high risk population.
* Completes and maintains all required documentation including, but not limited to progress notes, psychosocial, and treatment plans. Required documentation will show the client is being assisted with developing skills, psychoeducation and intervention to increase goal obtainment.
* Assist with education of community resources.

**Skills, Knowledge and Abilities:**

* Excellent verbal and written communication skills
* Willingness to work as part of a collaborative team
* Experience using Evidence Based Treatment
* Computer proficiency
* Ability to perform the essential functions of the job with or without a reasonable
* accommodation.

**Qualifications and Requirements:**

* Licensed Master Social Worker, Licensed Clinical Social Worker, Licensed Mental Health Counselor or Licensed Marriage and Family Therapist.

title: Hourly Bookkeeper (Nonprofit)
description:
***JOB SUMMARY*** 

We are seeking a detail-oriented and skilled part-time bookkeeper who will work onsite in our Englewood, NJ office during business hours for 8 hours per week. The consultant role offers a flexible schedule with potential for additional hours. The individual will invoice for services on a monthly basis.

The ideal candidate should be proficient in QuickBooks and Microsoft Excel and will ensure that nonprofit financial operations are accomplished efficiently and effectively. The role involves providing database support using QuickBooks to assist with Accounts Payables and Receivables, issuing monthly partner invoices, and overseeing vendor invoicing. The individual will also be responsible for critical data recording using Microsoft Excel spreadsheets. The position reports to the Executive Director and will work closely with the Program Departments and Finance Manager Consultant.

***POSITION DUTIES*** 

* **Accounts Receivables**
* Database entry of partner pledges in QuickBooks
* Generate and issue monthly invoices
* Oversee and manage collections and deposits
* Update tracking protocols and monitor payment portals on a timely basis
* **Accounts Payables**
* Enter vendor bills and artist invoices in QuickBooks
* Assist with bi-weekly bill payments
* Update tracking protocol and provide status reports
* Liaise with vendors and support purchasing procedures
* File documents digitally and physically
* Conduct interdepartmental communication related to financial operations
* Serve as a point person with vendors for office technology systems and platforms
* Support with grants and donor management tasks on occasion
* Execute special projects and/or research with the ED on occasion

***QUALIFICATIONS*** 

* **Knowledge of QuickBooks and Microsoft Excel required**
* Ability to effectively manage time and meet deadlines
* Ability to communicate effectively, both orally and in writing.
* Ability to analyze administrative, financial, and technical problems and recommend effective solutions
* Detail-oriented & able to work flexibly & collaboratively across different departments

***ABOUT ARTS HORIZONS*** 

Arts Horizons is one of the leading arts-in-education agencies serving New York and New Jersey by enhancing lifelong learning experiences and cultivating the joy of creative artmaking. We provide cross-cultural, multidisciplinary workshops and performances for early childhood through seniors. Arts Horizons is a registered 501(c)(3) non-profit organization and is committed to advancing Diversity, Equity, Inclusion, Belonging and Access. We offer a supportive work environment where ideas are valued, and achievements are recognized.

Pay: $22.00 per hour

* Office

* Monday to Friday

title: Vice President - Global Solution Engineering
description:
**Company Description**  

Freshworks makes it fast and easy for businesses to delight their customers and employees. We do this by taking a fresh approach to building and delivering software that is affordable, quick to implement, and designed for the end user. Headquartered in **San Mateo, California,** Freshworks has a global team operating from **13 global locations** to serve more than 65,000 companies - from startups to public companies – that rely on Freshworks software-as-a-service to enable a better customer experience (CRM, CX) and employee experience (ITSM).


Freshworks’ cloud-based software suite includes **Freshdesk** (omni-channel customer support), **Freshsales** (sales automation), **Freshmarketer** (marketing automation), **Freshservice** (IT service desk), **Freshchat (**AI-powered bots), supported by Neo, our underlying platform of shared services.


Freshworks is featured in global national press including CNBC, Forbes, Fortune, Bloomberg and has been a BuiltIn Best Place to work in San Francisco and Denver for the last 3 years. Our customer ratings have earned Freshworks products TrustRadius Top Rated Software ratings and G2 Best of Awards for Best Feature Set, Best Value for the Price and Best Relationship.

 **Job Description**  

As a pivotal leader in this global role, you will spearhead Freshworks' pre-sales initiatives, guiding a dynamic team of Solutions Engineers and Solutions Architects. Your mission will be to craft and deliver cutting-edge solutions that effectively illustrate the value of Freshworks' products to potential clients. This position reports directly to the Chief Field Operations Officer.


In this role, you will be responsible for overseeing our global field segment SE teams, managing leaders who oversee the mid-market, strategic enterprise segments and expansion SE teams and provide strategic direction to these teams. Day-to-day responsibilities include:

* Building a thoughtful GTM strategy for our cross-segment SE teams.
* Drive Strategic Initiatives that drive organizational improvement and alignment
* Participate in Top of the Funnel initiatives such as marketing webinars, speaking engagements etc.
* Drive excellence in the middle of the funnel execution from Discovery through Validation.
* Participate in deals (big and small; because some big business starts small) and provide executive leadership.
* Be the Voice of sales and drive thoughtful discussion and analysis on wins and losses.
* Work with the product organizations on identifying key gaps and make data driven recommendations.
* Design organizational OKRs to align with Sales strategy and Revenue goals.
* Lead the organization through quarterly performance check ins and annual performance reviews.
* Be a Diversity and Inclusion champion and create opportunities for underrepresented minority groups.
* Build a culture grounded in humility and empathy.


This role will also partner with the Senior VP of Sales for the regions and provide strategic insights into pipeline health, team performance and win rates. The successful incumbent will lean in when needed and participate in/lead initiatives outside of the Solution Engineering charter.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Team Leadership & Mentoring: Lead and inspire a high-achieving team of Solutions Engineers and Solutions Architects, driving excellence and fostering a collaborative environment.
* Strategic Planning: Partner with the executive team to develop and implement pre-sales strategies that align with Freshworks' broader business goals.
* Solution Development: Oversee the creation of standardized demos, proof of concepts (POCs), and Centers of Excellence that showcase Freshworks' innovative solutions.
* Customer Engagement: Engage directly with key clients to understand their needs, tailoring pre-sales activities to address their specific challenges and objectives.
* Cross-Functional Collaboration: Work closely with Sales, Marketing, Product, and Customer Success teams to ensure cohesive go-to-market strategies and alignment.
* Product Insight: Stay informed about product developments and updates, integrating this knowledge into pre-sales activities to highlight Freshworks' evolving offerings.

  

**Qualifications**  

* Strategic Visionary: A seasoned leader with a proven track record in guiding pre-sales teams. Your strategic vision and hands-on approach ensure that pre-sales initiatives are effectively aligned with business objectives.
* Technical Expertise: Possess a solid technical foundation and experience in programming, enabling you to lead your team in creating impactful and standardized demonstrations of our products' capabilities.
* Business Acumen: Demonstrated ability to translate technical features into compelling business value, navigating market trends and customer needs to drive global pre-sales success.
* Adaptable & Insightful: Proactive in anticipating industry changes and implementing necessary adjustments. Your adaptability ensures that pre-sales efforts remain at the forefront of industry advancements.
* Decisive Agility: Thrive in dynamic environments, making agile decisions to keep pre-sales strategies effective and responsive to evolving market conditions.
* Commitment to Excellence: Dedicated to continuous improvement and optimization of pre-sales programs. Your commitment to staying informed about industry advancements drives program efficiency and impact.

**Requirements:**

* Educational Background: Degree in Computer Science or a related field, or equivalent experience preferred.
* Leadership Experience: Proven experience in a leadership role within pre-sales, with a focus on managing Solutions Engineers and Solutions Architects.
* Industry Knowledge: Experience in the DevOps sector and a strong ability to keep up with industry trends.
* Technical Skills: Robust background in programming and hands-on experience in developing demos and POCs.
* Customer Relationship Management: Demonstrated success in building and maintaining strong customer relationships.

  

**Additional Information**  

The targeted annual base salary range for this position is $276,000 — $374,000 USD.


Compensation is based on a variety of factors including but not limited to location, experience, job-related skills, and level. Bonus/equity may be available.


Freshworks offers multiple options for dental, medical, vision, disability and life insurances. Equity + ESPP, flexible PTO, flexible spending, commuter benefits and wellness benefits are also offered. Freshworks also offers adoption and parental leave benefits.


Please note this is a hybrid role that requires an in-office presence 3 days / week (Tue-Thur)


At Freshworks, we are creating a global workplace that enables everyone to find their true potential, purpose, and passion irrespective of their background, gender, race, sexual orientation, religion and ethnicity. We are committed to providing equal opportunity for all and believe that diversity in the workplace creates a more vibrant, richer work environment that advances the goals of our employees, communities and the business.

title: Social Worker L II - Mental Health Continuum, MPA Behavioral Health Admin -Morrisania
description:
About NYC Health + Hospitals

**Empower Every New Yorker — Without Exception — to Live the Healthiest Life Possible**

NYC Health + Hospitals is the largest public health care system in the United States. We provide essential outpatient, inpatient and home-based services to more than one million New Yorkers every year across the city’s five boroughs. Our large health system consists of ambulatory centers, acute care centers, post-acute care/long-term care, rehabilitation programs, Home Care, and Correctional Health Services. Our diverse workforce is uniquely focused on empowering New Yorkers, without exception, to live the healthiest life possible.

At NYC Health + Hospitals, our mission is to deliver high quality care health services, without exception. Every employee takes a person-centered approach that exemplifies the ICARE values (Integrity, Compassion, Accountability, Respect, and Excellence) through empathic communication and partnerships between all persons.

Job Description

**Purpose of Position**

The Licensed Social Worker LVL II is an LMSW or an LCSW who works independently as well as in collaboration with transdisciplinary teams as a primary therapist who identifies psychosocial issues and concerns of patients and their families and provide clinical services to meet their needs. The Mental Health Continuum is a collaboration of various agencies, including the Department of Education. Through this collaboration, the Social Worker will support the behavioral health needs of students in the South Bronx. They function as a therapist in the Child Outpatient Mental Health Clinic and School Based Clinic servicing child and adolescents with severe mental health conditions and co-morbid medical and substance use disorders. The goal is to provide meaningful and stable connections between school staff, who know their students and families’ best, and mental health service providers committed to serving their local communities. This will allow Lincoln to more rapidly see students in need of urgent evaluation, assessment, treatment and referrals for additional support.

**Areas of Responsibility**

Licensed clinician with minimum 1 year of experience working clinically with the individuals with mental health conditions and substance addicted who will be responsible for providing individual and group therapy to patients in the Child and Adolescent Outpatient Department of Behavioral Health. Candidate must have knowledge of resources and services for this population.

**Summary of Duties & Responsibilities:**

The duties include functioning as a primary therapist for subset of patients treated in the Child and Adolescent Outpatient Clinic, facilitates group therapy, conducting initial psychiatric assessment, documenting biopsychosocial assessments, formulation and disposition, developing comprehensive treatment plans, writing discharge summaries and other related paperwork. The therapist is responsible for facilitating supportive, psychoeducational and insight-oriented psychotherapeutic interventions, providing crisis interventions, engaging with and providing support to families, and engaging them in the process of recovery. The candidate is responsible for identifying and collaborating with existing support systems, facilitating community referrals for patients as needed collaborating with interdisciplinary team to develop most appropriate case dispositions, while documenting all interventions within the required regulatory timeframes. In collaboration with select schools, the Social Worker will provide timely mental health clinic appointments, urgent care, and tele-video visits to the students while in school or at home.

Minimum Qualifications

For Assignment to Level II  
1. Valid license as an LMSW issued by the NYSED; or  
2. Valid license as an LCSW issued by the NYSED.

Department Preferences

* At minimum 1 year experience working with the mentally ill, substance abuse and intellectually disabled population as primary therapist or evaluator.
* English proficient a must, ability to communicate in Spanish a plus.

Knowledgeable in:

* Mental Health and service delivery to adults

How To Apply

If you wish to apply for this position, please apply online by clicking the "Apply Now" button.

*If applying online, please include your cover letter in the same file attachment with your uploaded resume.*

NYC Health and Hospitals offers a competitive benefits package that includes:

* Comprehensive Health Benefits for employees hired to work 20+ hrs. per week
* Retirement Savings and Pension Plans
* Loan Forgiveness Programs for eligible employees
* Paid Holidays and Vacation in accordance with employees' Collectively bargained contracts
* College tuition discounts and professional development opportunities
* Multiple employee discounts programs

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $82,400.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Employee discount
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* Day shift

License/Certification:

* license as a NYS LMSW issued by the NYSED (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Executive Recruiter
description:
**Description**
---------------


**Job Description:**

The Executive Recruiter is responsible for sourcing, qualifying, and matching candidates to defined executive level roles (OC-1, OC-2, and OC-3) and profiles (VP and above) with specific open requisitions across various Business Units. This role will guide HR partners, OC members and their respective direct reports, on candidate sourcing strategies, targeted recruitment channels and existing and expected market conditions. They will develop a thorough understanding of the business, client needs and specific talent pools and share detailed and consistent reporting on search detail/status.


**Major Responsibilities:**

* Develop and facilitate recruiting strategy with hiring manager (OC members and/or their direct reports), partnering closely to understand and account for team dynamic and culture
* Actively pursue all channels (professional networks, social media, and association affiliations) to source, attract and effectively close best in class talent for senior level roles
* Manage the full recruitment cycle for complex executive level roles; liaise with internal partners and external vendors to close candidates
* Maintain strict discretion/confidentiality with details of searches
* Maximize direct hiring, using agency/vendor channels only when approved by VP
* Manage data integrity within Workday applicant tracking system, and Beamery, ensuring timely entry within both database systems
* Counsel hiring managers on interview skills throughout the process to ensure compliance and to minimize risk factors
* Prioritize among multiple requisitions, conflicting priorities, and short timelines dependent upon alignment with individual lines of business and with Gartner’s strategic direction
* Build pipelines of high quality, diverse senior level candidates for bench strength and succession planning by developing and proactively managing a network of recruitment and referral sources
* Provide coaching and guidance to junior level recruiting staff

**Job Requirements**

* Minimum 7 years’ experience of recruiting experience, handling the full lifecycle across complex roles and differing profiles
* Preferred previous experience in executive level recruiting with hiring manager contact up to senior most organizational level
* Proven track record of success self-sourcing and using all available networking/social channels to build candidate pools.
* Experience handling complex, high level offer negotiations
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills
* Proven ability to successfully work with senior executives and their respective teams

#LI-KT3


**Who are we?**


At Gartner, Inc. (NYSE:IT), we guide the leaders who shape the world.


Our mission relies on expert analysis and bold ideas to deliver actionable, objective insight, helping enterprise leaders and their teams succeed with their mission-critical priorities.


Since our founding in 1979, we’ve grown to more than 20,000 associates globally who support ~15,000 client enterprises in ~90 countries and territories. We do important, interesting and substantive work that matters. That’s why we hire associates with the intellectual curiosity, energy and drive to want to make a difference. The bar is unapologetically high. So is the impact you can have here.


**What makes Gartner a great place to work?**


Our sustained success creates limitless opportunities for you to grow professionally and flourish personally. We have a vast, virtually untapped market potential ahead of us, providing you with an exciting trajectory long into the future. How far you go is driven by your passion and performance.


We hire remarkable people who collaborate and win as a team. Together, our singular, unifying goal is to deliver results for our clients.


Our teams are inclusive and composed of individuals from different geographies, cultures, religions, ethnicities, races, genders, sexual orientations, abilities and generations.


We invest in great leaders who bring out the best in you and the company, enabling us to multiply our impact and results. This is why, year after year, we are recognized worldwide as a great place to work .


**What do we offer?**


Gartner offers world-class benefits, highly competitive compensation and disproportionate rewards for top performers.


In our hybrid work environment, we provide the flexibility and support for you to thrive — working virtually when it's productive to do so and getting together with colleagues in a vibrant community that is purposeful, engaging and inspiring.


Ready to grow your career with Gartner? Join us.


Gartner believes in fair and equitable pay. A reasonable estimate of the base salary range for this role is 92,000 USD - 130,500 USD. Please note that actual salaries may vary within the range, or be above or below the range, based on factors including, but not limited to, education, training, experience, professional achievement, business need, and location. In addition to base salary, employees will participate in either an annual bonus plan based on company and individual performance, or a role-based, uncapped sales incentive plan. Our talent acquisition team will provide the specific opportunity on our bonus or incentive programs to eligible candidates. We also offer market leading benefit programs including generous PTO, a 401k match up to $7,200 per year, the opportunity to purchase company stock at a discount, and more.  

  

The policy of Gartner is to provide equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, citizenship status, age, national origin, ancestry, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected status and to affirmatively seek to advance the principles of equal employment opportunity.


Gartner is committed to being an Equal Opportunity Employer and offers opportunities to all job seekers, including job seekers with disabilities. If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran, you may request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access the Company’s career webpage as a result of your disability. You may request reasonable accommodations by calling Human Resources at +1 (203) 964-0096 or by sending an email to ApplicantAccommodations@gartner.com .


Job Requisition ID:90935
By submitting your information and application, you confirm that you have read and agree to the country or regional recruitment notice linked below applicable to your place of residence.

title: Springdale Elementary School: Long-Term Substitute Elementary Teacher - Grade 2
description:
JobID: 12008  

**Position Type:**  

 Substitute/Long-Term Substitute Teacher  

**Date Posted:**  

 9/25/2024  

**Location:**  

 Stamford, CT  

**Date Available:**  

 10/11/2024 **The filling of this position is based upon continued funding in the Board of Education budget.**  

  

**Note: Teachers dually certified in TESOL, Bilingual Education or ESL, with experience in Sheltered Instruction or fluency in a language other than English, will be given preference for all Stamford Public School positions.**  

  

  

**Job Description** – Elementary Teacher  

  

**General Statement:**  

A competent **Elementary Teacher** understands growth and development, demonstrates knowledge of what is to be taught and facility in the basic skills and helps students to develop positive self-concepts. The **Elementary Teacher** stimulates the independence of each student as a learner, effectively assesses student needs and progress, and plans instruction to achieve selected objectives, including those appropriate for exceptional students. The **Elementary Teacher** accomplishes these objectives through effective communication with students, parents and colleagues, and through the use of appropriate techniques and materials in a positive climate where time, space and equipment are effectively organized for instruction. In addition, the **Elementary Teacher** meets professional responsibility for continuing growth and fosters cooperative involvement with parents and the community.  

  

**Major Responsibilities:**
+ Demonstrates facility in the skills of reading, writing and mathematics.
+ Demonstrates knowledge of the subject to be taught.
+ Demonstrates knowledge of human growth and development as it relates to the teaching-learning process.
+ Demonstrates knowledge of the American public school system.
+ Plans instruction to achieve selected objectives.
+ Effectively implements instructional plans and uses appropriate instructional techniques.
+ Effectively communicates with students.
+ Helps students develop positive self-concepts.
+ Facilitates the independence of the student as learner.
+ Effectively organizes time, space, materials and equipment for instruction.
+ Effectively assesses student needs and progress.
+ Effectively meets the needs of exceptional students.
+ Establishes a positive learning environment.
+ Meets professional responsibilities.
+ Encourages and maintains the cooperative involvement and support of parents and the community.

**Qualifications:**
+ A valid Connecticut teacher certificate in 013-Elementary, K-6; 305-Elementary, 1–6.
+ Demonstrated excellence in teaching the subject area(s) and/or instructional levels targeted.
+ Evidence of ability to work cooperatively with administrators, teachers and educational assistants.
+ Evidence of organizational ability and willingness to pursue tasks to successful completion.
+ Superior communication skills (oral and written).
+ Knowledge of and/or demonstrate the ability to learn and implement Operating Systems (i.e. Windows); Office suites (i.e. Microsoft Office, Google Docs); Presentation Software (i.e. PowerPoint, Keynote); Spreadsheets (i.e. Excel, Google Spreadsheets); Communication and Collaboration tools (i.e. Skype); Accounting Software (i.e. QuickBooks); Student Information Systems (i.e. Naviance, Power School); or any other technology deemed relevant for this position.

**Connecticut State Department of Education Certification:**  

This assignment is expected to continue for more than 40 days, and therefore we are seeking a certified candidate. If you are not currently certified in CT, but hold a Bachelor's degree and 12 credits in the content area to be taught, we will apply to the CSDE for Long-Term Substitute Authorization.  

  

**Long-Term Substitute Teacher Compensation:**  

$155 per day  

  

**Application Procedures:**  

Online application is required.

title: Apples Preschool: Before and After School Care: Special Education Paraeducator
description:
JobID: 12011  

**Position Type:**  

 Before- and After-School Program  

**Date Posted:**  

 9/25/2024  

**Location:**  

 APPLES Preschool  

**Date Available:**  

 2024-2025 School Year  

**Closing Date:**  

 10/01/2024  


 Apples Preschool has the following needs for Special Education Paraeducators to support students before and after the regular school day for the 2023-2024 school year:  

  

BeforeCare Program - 7:15am - 8:00am  

AfterCare Program - 2:45pm - 5:00pm  

  

**Position Title:** Paraeducator  

  

**Purpose:** To support general education students with age appropriate supervision and activities that support their learning and keep students safe.  

  

**Example of Duties and Responsibilities:**  

  

+ Plan age appropriate activities for students to participate in daily
+ facilitate the movement of students from activity to activity
+ follow a schedule was written by the administrator
+ assist with daily living needs such as feeding and bathroom accommodations
+ Work collaboratively on a team to support the needs of preschool students.
+ serve as the chief source of information and help to any substitute teacher assigned in the absence of the regular teacher
+ ability to assist nurse or other staff member with procedures required by learners who have special health care needs.
+ maintain the same high level of ethical behavior and sensitivity of information about students as is expected of a certified teacher.
+ help students master equipment or instructional materials.
+ assist in providing a well-organized, smoothly functioning after school environment
+ talk to and attempt to calm students who are distressed
+ participate in professional development training programs as required
+ perform other related duties, as assigned.
+ Must commit to work the time scheduled, if needing to be absent, must get a substitute and notify administrator 24 hours prior to the absence.


  

Knowledge skills and abilities- All stay the same  

  

**Job Description**  

  

**POSITION TITLE:** PARAEDUCATOR – SPECIAL EDUCATION (GENERAL)  

  

**PURPOSE:**  

To serve as an integral member of the instructional team to provider services to individual student(s) in accordance with the goals/objectives identified by the Individual Education Plan (IEP).  

  

**SUPERVISION RECEIVED:**  

Certified Staff Professional(s) and/or appropriate Administrator.  

  

**EXAMPLES OF DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES:**  

  

**STUDENT SUPPORT DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES:**
+ Work with individual students or small groups of students, under the supervision of a certified teacher, to reinforce learning of materials or skills initially introduced by the teacher.
+ Collect data on student progress, under the direction of the teacher, for individual students or groups of students.
+ Follow student schedule(s), as written by certified staff, i.e. administrators, teachers, related service providers, etc. and seek clarification as needed.
+ Assist the teacher in the handling, operation, and care of equipment used in the classroom, including media and instructional materials.
+ Assist with the supervision of students during emergency drills, assembles, play periods, field trips, and in other non-classroom activities.
+ Support with implementation of goals and objectives (IEP) as assigned by certified staff, and maintain strict confidentiality of the same.
+ Foster independence in students through implementation of Independence goal(s) and other strategies
+ Assist with daily living needs, such as feeding and bathroom accommodations.
+ Assist with organization and on-task behavior
+ Implement behavior intervention plans under the direction of a certified staff member.
+ Serve as the chief source of information and help to any substitute teacher assigned in the absence of the regular teacher.
+ Assist with implementation of Health Care plans for students and other medical needs.
+ Alert the teacher(s) regarding any problem or special information related to an individual student.
+ Help students master equipment or instructional materials assigned by teacher.
+ Assist other students in an inclusion classroom.

  

**GENERAL/ADMINISTRATIVE DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES:**
+ Participate in professional development training programs, as required.
+ Perform other related duties, as assigned.
+ Maintain the same high level of ethical behavior and sensitivity of information about students as is expected of a certified teacher.
+ Exhibit a clear understanding of the IEP information as it pertains to their role as an implementer.
+ Distribute and collect workbooks, papers, and other materials for instruction as needed.

  

**KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIES:**
+ Effective communication and interpersonal skills.
+ Demonstrated ability to understand and follow oral and written instructions effectively.
+ Exhibits proficiency in basic reading, math, writing, and speaking English.
+ Must possess or be willing to acquire the skills necessary to work productively with children.
+ Appropriate reading, spelling, writing, and math skills to support student.
+ Physical condition commensurate with the demands of, at a minimum, the essential functions of the position.
+ Must exhibit good judgment, patience, tact, and courtesy.
+ Utilizes and maintains ethical practices for confidential communication about students.
+ Ability to establish and maintain cooperative and effective working relationships.

  

**MINIMUM Qualifications:**
+ Must follow the Every Student Succeeds Act (ESSA) requirements and have passed the ParaPro Assessment, hold an Associate’s Degree, or have completed at least 60 credits at an approved college
+ Must possess or be willing to acquire the skills necessary to support any specialized programs for Special Needs students, including support of behavioral plans, strategies for autism or other identified diagnoses, or support for treatments such as ABA or activities of daily living such as feeding and toileting.
+ Experience/training in working with children preferred.
+ Comfort with use of standard computer applications.
+ Such additions and alternatives to the above qualifications as may be appropriate and acceptable.
+ Staff can choose the following days and that these days need to be consistent.

  

+ Monday, Wednesday, Frida
+ Tuesday, Thursday
+ Monday through Friday

  

  

  

**WORKING CONDITIONS:**  

Environment:+ The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. This will include indoor office/classroom settings, outdoor play, recreation areas and field trip locations.

  

**PHYSICAL DEMANDS:**  

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to perform the essential functions of this job successfully. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.+ While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit for extended periods of time to view & operate computer equipment, and to stand for extended periods of time to assist student(s) and/or staff.
+ The employee frequently is required to stand, walk, sit, bend, stoop and kneel.
+ The employee is frequently required to reach with hands and arms.
+ The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 40 pounds.
+ Specific vision abilities required by this job include vision, distance vision, and the ability to adjust focus.


  

**EMPLOYEE GROUP:**Paraeducators of Stamford Association  

  

**WORK YEAR:**As per Bargaining Agreement

 Stamford, CT  

**Date Available:**  

 10/09/2024 **The filling of this position is based upon continued funding in the Board of Education budget.**  

  

**Note: Teachers dually certified in TESOL, Bilingual Education or ESL, with experience in Sheltered Instruction or fluency in a language other than English, will be given preference for all Stamford Public School positions.**
**Note: Candidates must possess certification in both Physical Education and Health.**  

  

  

**Job Description** – Physical Education Teacher  

  

**General Statement:**  

A competent **Physical Education Teacher** understands growth and development, demonstrates knowledge of what is to be taught and facility in the basic skills and helps students to develop positive self-concepts. The **Physical Education Teacher** stimulates the independence of each student as a learner, effectively assesses student needs and progress, and plans instruction to achieve selected objectives, including those appropriate for exceptional students. The **Physical Education Teacher** accomplishes these objectives through effective communication with students, parents and colleagues, and through the use of appropriate techniques and materials in a positive climate where time, space and equipment are effectively organized for instruction. In addition, the **Physical Education Teacher** meets professional responsibility for continuing growth and fosters cooperative involvement with parents and the community.  

  

**Major Responsibilities:**
+ Demonstrates facility in the skills of reading, writing and mathematics.
+ Demonstrates knowledge of the subject to be taught.
+ Demonstrates knowledge of human growth and development as it relates to the teaching-learning process.
+ Demonstrates knowledge of the American public school system.
+ Plans instruction to achieve selected objectives.
+ Effectively implements instructional plans and uses appropriate instructional techniques.
+ Effectively communicates with students.
+ Helps students develop positive self-concepts.
+ Facilitates the independence of the student as learner.
+ Effectively organizes time, space, materials and equipment for instruction.
+ Effectively assesses student needs and progress.
+ Effectively meets the needs of exceptional students.
+ Establishes a positive learning environment.
+ Meets professional responsibilities.
+ Encourages and maintains the cooperative involvement and support of parents and the community.

**Qualifications:**
+ A valid Connecticut teacher certificate in 044-Physical Education, PK–12.
+ Demonstrated excellence in teaching the subject area(s) and/or instructional levels targeted.
+ Evidence of ability to work cooperatively with administrators, teachers and educational assistants.
+ Evidence of organizational ability and willingness to pursue tasks to successful completion.
+ Superior communication skills (oral and written).
+ Knowledge of and/or demonstrate the ability to learn and implement Operating Systems (i.e. Windows); Office suites (i.e. Microsoft Office, Google Docs); Presentation Software (i.e. PowerPoint, Keynote); Spreadsheets (i.e. Excel, Google Spreadsheets); Communication and Collaboration tools (i.e. Skype); Accounting Software (i.e. QuickBooks); Student Information Systems (i.e. Naviance, Power School); or any other technology deemed relevant for this position.


  

Sept. 1991

This assignment is expected to continue for more than 40 days, and therefore we are seeking a certified candidate. If you are not currently certified in CT, but hold a Bachelor's degree and 12 credits in the content area to be taught, we will apply to the CSDE for Long-Term Substitute Authorization.

title: Document Management Supervisor
description:
We are looking for a document management supervisor to join our team. As a document management supervisor , you will be in charge of all controlled documents for our company, making sure everyone is on the same page when they need to be. You will also create, design and maintain the architecture for document processes and procedures and enforce the proper chain of action and document identification. You will go through all controlled documents and make edits, updates, and check for accuracy. Once this process is complete, you will approve the document and distribute it to the correct persons. You must also ensure proper labeling, numbering, and accessibility to employees.  

* Update and control procedure documents and forms.
* Create and manage document hierarchy and process systems.
* Take charge of all document identification, classification, and filing.
* Frequently conduct document audits confirming they are current and accurately reflect recorded evidence.
* Ensure revised documents are accessible.
* Assist with communication during external audits.
* Conform to company enforced specifications and document control procedures.
* Train document control clerks and delegate and oversee their tasks.
* Train employees in the company’s controlled document processes to ensure correct handling of documents from the ground up.
* Oversee document through its entire lifecycle (inception to archival).
* Check and edit incoming documents and prepare for distribution.
* Create document filing and organizing systems that are both effective and efficient.
* Ensure proper organization and security of documents (paper and electronic).
* Log document requests and help retrieve documents as needed for employees.
* Make available, notify and distribute documents to relevant recipients.
* Confirm delivery of documents to proper personnel.
* Collaborate and communicate with managers and project leaders.

**Document Management Supervisor Requirements and Qualifications:**  

* Detail-oriented and meticulous work ethic.
* Extremely organized and efficient.
* Proven skill for creating and implementing controlled document processes.
* Work well under pressure and have impressive stress management.
* Strong oral and written communication skills.
* Proclivity for catching errors and enacting appropriate changes.
* Able to prioritize and delegate tasks.
* Outstanding time-management.
* Strong interpersonal skills.
* Excellent analytical ability.
* Archival experience.
* 5+ years of relevant experience.
* Proficient in SharePoint, ProArc and/or other document management software and web-based tools.
* Skilled user of Adobe and Microsoft Suite.
* Expert data organizer.

 **Job Type**: Full-time  

**Benefits:**  

* 401(k) matching

**Schedule:**  

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

**Supplemental Pay:**  

* Bonus pay

**Experience:**  

* Microsoft Office: 1 year (Required)
* Supervisor: 3 years (Required)

 **Work Location:** In person

title: Oil Delivery Driver
description:
Are you looking for a career with an industry leader? We have just the opportunity for you! We are a leading home services provider and are looking for a responsible Oil Delivery Driver to join our team. In this role, you will effectively deliver home heating oil promptly to our customers using tank trucks and/or tractor trailers. You will represent our company in a professional and cost effective manner aiming at increasing profitability and customer satisfaction; delivering home heating oil to residential establishments. We offer competitive compensation and benefits, as well overtime opportunities during the busy winter season. You may also find room for advancement with us. If this sounds like the kind of career move you've been wanting to make and if you meet our qualifications, we want to talk with you!



The pay rate for an experienced driver is up to $32 per hour.


**Responsibilities:**



As an Oil Delivery Driver, you will make routine deliveries to customer's homes and provide them with timely and safe oil deliveries. Since you will be the key component in ensuring safe and prompt delivery to our customers, you must always follow company policies and procedures to promote safety as well as DOT regulations.


**Your specific duties include:**


* Follow route and time schedule
* Load, unload, prepare, inspect and operate delivery vehicle
* Complete logs and reports
* Follow DOT regulations and safety standards

**Requirements:**



As an Oil Delivery Driver you will use your navigation and safety skills to successfully deliver home heating oil to our customers. You will need to be detail-oriented as well as focused with a flexible and adaptable nature.


**Specific qualifications include:**


* High School Diploma or Equivalent
* Valid CDL Class A or B driver's license with Tank & HazMat endorsements
* Ability to meet the company's motor vehicle policy
* TWIC card a plus
* Ability to meet all DOT requirements including road test and drug screen
* Must be reliable, diligent, dependable
* Ability to effectively utilize maps, locate addresses
* Oil delivery experience a plus
* Possible nights, weekend work; potential overtime


**Benefits:**



As an Oil Delivery Driver, you will be part of an evolving organization that built its reputation on providing our customers with the best possible service. Our employees are, of course, one of the main keys to our continued success and so, we are committed to your professional development, and you may find opportunities for advancement to roles of greater responsibility with us.



Your hard work and professional dedication will be rewarded with a competitive compensation and benefits package, including:


* Medical coverage (F/T Staff)
* Dental coverage (F/T Staff)
* Retirement Savings
* Plus more!


***Build a rewarding career with an industry leader!***

  

***Apply now!***


***We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer and are committed to a drug and alcohol-free workplace.***

title: Behavioral Technician (Part-Time)
description:
\\*Up to $25 per hour\\*

Job Type: Part-Time in Brooklyn, NY

Are you passionate about making a positive impact in the lives of individuals with autism or behavioral challenges? As a Behavioral Technician, you will embark on a rewarding journey to provide one-on-one intervention to teach communication, social, and daily living skills to reduce challenging behaviors in the home, community, and school settings.

At Encore Support Services, our mission is to provide cutting-edge therapies to nurture children with autism, so they gain as much independence as possible to grow into functioning and contributing members of society.

* Flexible work schedule

* Health, Dental, and Vision Insurance for full-time employees

* Measure and monitor the effectiveness of each client's progress and treatment plans by collecting and reporting critical data using our advanced technology tools.
* Communicate professionally with clients and their families
* Directly implement services in the designated setting(s) (school, home, community) as set by your supervisor.
* Modify performances based on feedback provided by your supervisor and insurance provider.
* Attend initial and continued trainings as directed by the agency or company

* High school diploma or equivalent.

* Ability to maintain HIPAA confidentiality laws and professionalism at all times.
* Exceptional communication, problem-solving, and organizational skills.

\\*Apply now and let's create change together!

Encore Support ABA provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, veteran status, sex, national origin, age, disability, or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, Encore Support ABA complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training.

title: Project Coordinator
description:
***Econoco Corporation***, a reputable and well-established family-owned business that has specialized in the creative design, import and distribution of displays and mannequins for the retail industry for over 98 years is seeking a ***Project Coordinator*** to join our growing team in **Hicksville, NY.**

At ***Econoco*** we understand that our people are our most valuable resource. You will enjoy an inclusive, helpful, solutions focused, team-oriented work environment where our core values mean everything:

* **Helpful –** What can we bring to the situation vs. what can we get from it?
* **Solutions Focused -** get creative with client and colleague requests and general problem solving;no “cant’s”; Get out of the problem and Into the Solution!
* **Do the Right Thing -** regardless of restraints, do what's right for the team and our customers; show respect for all.
* **Follows Through –** Take ownership, finish what we start, and deliver on promises.
* **Be Human-** positively impact the people with whom we interact; we make mistakes, we admit ours and forgive others’; RESPECT!

***Your major responsibilities in this seat are:***

* Manage and direct the work of project managers and provide managerial oversight over multiple jobs
* Monitor project scopes, costs, schedules, communications and contractual deliveries
* Develop standards, processes, and tools used for effective project scheduling and to set and manage quality targets
* Address internal or vendor issues that may impede project timelines and develop solutions
* Establish data collection and reporting processes to capture key metrics of project activities and provide periodic reporting
* Ensure the department milestones/goals are met and adhering to approval budgets
* Full knowledge of the Project Management department including all functions and processes
* Get things done inside the Econoco process workflow, thinking outside the box as required

***We are looking for someone with the following skills and capabilities:***

* Bachelor’s degree in communications, or other relevant fields, or equivalent years of work experience required
* Minimum three (3) years’ experience in full life cycle, customer facing project coordination required
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite, familiar with CRM hubs systems or e-commerce hubs; Salesforce and Response Pro knowledge a plus (will train)
* Solutions focused with excellent problem-solving skills to meet customer expectations and company goals
* Strong organizational skills with attention to detail
* Ability to manage multiple projects at various stages simultaneously
* Strong communication skills, both oral and written, have the ability to work independently and efficiently to meet the customers’ needs

***What we offer:***

* Medical, Dental and Vision Insurance
* Life Insurance and HRA (Health Reimbursement Account)
* Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
* 401K with company match %
* Aflac Plans offered (Accident, Cancer, Disability, Life)
* Generous Paid time off/sick time
* 8-10 paid Holidays annually
* Company sponsored Events
* Employee recognition
* Opportunity for company-wide bonus
* Coffee, tea, stocked refrigerator, healthy snacks and Ice Cream birthdays!

Pay: $55,000.00 - $65,000.00 per year

title: Leasing Representative
description:
**Overview**

Join Rose Associates, a renowned leader in New York City's real estate scene for nearly a century. We're expanding our team and seeking a customer-focused Leasing Representative for our multifamily properties. If you're dynamic and ready to showcase available units while ensuring a positive leasing experience, join us today!

**Essential Job Functions**

* Conduct property tours, showcase units, communicate value, greet clients, assess needs, answer inquiries in-person, by phone, and email, provide leasing info, schedule appointments.
* Gather necessary documents, conduct background and credit checks, communicate application status and leasing decisions.
* Foster positive connections with prospects, residents, and management, ensuring a welcoming and professional leasing office atmosphere.
* Collaborate with maintenance team, ensure resident satisfaction, communicate effectively about repairs and lease concerns.
* Complete weekly and monthly reports, including traffic analyses as assigned.
* Receive and record deposits and rent payments accurately.
* Monitor local market trends, provide feedback on challenges, contribute to leasing and marketing strategies.
* Prepare and implement lease agreements, maintain organized leasing documentation.
* Must be present on-site, with the ability to move throughout the building, ensuring effective communication with tenants, staff, vendors, and visitors.
* Ability to ascend and descend stairs and be comfortable with exposure to varying environmental climates and circumstances.
* Position may be required to perform duties outside their normal responsibilities as needed.

**Qualifications**

* High school diploma or equivalent; bachelor’s degree in business, Marketing, or a related field is a plus.
* A minimum of 1 year of leasing experience is required.
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
* Proficiency in navigating computers and property management software, to include Microsoft Office include iLuvLeasing, On-Site, and Yardi.
* Knowledge of fair housing regulations and leasing practices.
* Valid NYS real estate license is required or ability to obtain one within the first 120 days of employment. All active license holders must register their license with the Company upon hire.
* Work authorization (required).
* Must be able to work weekends (Saturdays and Sundays).

In addition to base compensation, significant incentive pay and benefits packages are available.

Rose Associates requires all colleagues to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 unless there is an approved religious or medical exemption.

title: Business Development Manager - RN License Needed
description:

referral growth. Accountable for the execution of growth activities and

achievement of the Agency’s admissions growth objectives.

**RESPONSIBILITIES:**

* Works with Director to set admissions goals and objectives; monitors outcomes for business development representatives. Ensures implementation of tools needed for success; coaches and mentors team.
* Meets at least weekly with each team member individually and the team as a group at least twice per month.
* Dedicates at least 50% of work time making sales calls with business development representatives and liaisons in the community.
* Assists with securing referral partner contracts and service agreements with key accounts.
* Develops and delivers presentations to internal and external stakeholders.
* Supervises business development representatives, including but not limited to: performance evaluations, timesheets, interviewing potential staff and providing required personnel documents.
* Identifies and advises leadership staff in regard to issues related to referral partners in the community.

NYS Registered Nurse License is mandatory
