title: Director, Audience Measurement
description:
***Welcome to Warner Bros. Discovery… the stuff dreams are made of.***

**Who We Are…**

When we say, “the stuff dreams are made of,” we’re not just referring to the world of wizards, dragons and superheroes, or even to the wonders of Planet Earth. Behind WBD’s vast portfolio of iconic content and beloved brands, are the *storytellers* bringing our characters to life, the *creators* bringing them to your living rooms and the *dreamers* creating what’s next…


From brilliant creatives, to technology trailblazers, across the globe, WBD offers career defining opportunities, thoughtfully curated benefits, and the tools to explore and grow into your best selves. Here you are supported, here you are celebrated, here you can thrive.

**Director, Audience Measurement**


This is an exciting opportunity to join the Measurement & Attribution team that is part of the larger WBD Ad Sales Research, Data & Insights department at Warner Bros Discovery. This position will be focused on developing and testing new innovative ad solutions and establishing workflows for planning, optimizing and measuring audiences (broad demo and advanced audiences) to drive greater value for Warner Bros Discovery’s advertiser partners.


The Director role on the Audience Measurement team must be adept at media measurement (methodological approaches to multiplatform deduplication) and have a working knowledge of data and systems used in digital & linear advertising, as the role requires working closely across multiple functions across the broader WBD Ad Sales organization to help build new products. This person will work with cutting edge media measurement and currency partners to customize and implement their offerings. This person will also assist in providing leading-edge analysis, recommendations and thought leadership specific to audience measurement. The ideal person is a nimble, go-getter who enjoys collaborating with partners. This position calls for a candidate that both exhibits operational excellence in the projects that they manage and is adept at identifying innovative solutions to potential issues that might arise during the course of a project.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Must work with multiple partners (including product, engineering, data science, privacy, legal, and ad operations) to help design and build Data-Driven Video (DDV) offerings from Warner Bros Discovery.
* Oversees the development and execution of WBD’s Proof of Concept (PoC) initiatives that are designed to accelerate WBD’s next generation measurement and currency capabilities.
* Build and maintain strong relationships with WBD’s measurement providers, leveraging their companies’ unique data offerings and methodological expertise to drive incremental improvements to the WBD’s measurement of client campaigns.
* Work with sales leads to ensure WBD’s audience measurement offerings are clear to our brand and agency clients, as well as gather requested improvements to further WBD’s capabilities in providing effective audience measurement.
* Works with other members of the Audience Measurement team so that it can be a center of excellence within the overall Ad Sales Research, Data & Insights department.
* Track and synthesize the data assets & methodology for common 3rd party measurement offerings that WBD or their advertiser partners might have an interest in.
* Conduct in-depth analyses of linear & digital datasets that employ methodological revisions that will alter reported audience levels from the existing offering from the measurement partner so top-level findings can be shared across appropriate internal teams.
* Assist in the formulation of a WBD point-of-view on media measurement, which could include the creation of presentations, white papers and work on industry committees to share WBD’s learnings and knowledge in the media measurement space.
* Perform other duties as required.

**Requirements:**

* 8-12 years at an ad-tech, media measurement, programmer or ad agency where their role provided hands on-experience experience in media measurement and the development of measurement products.
* Experience and familiarity with programming languages (SQL, Python, R) that can be used to conduct data analyses.
* Solid knowledge of the major linear and digital TV measurement reporting services (e.g. Comscore, iSpot.tv, Nielsen and VideoAmp, in alphabetical order).
* Solid knowledge of cross-platform and addressable measurement of broad demo and advanced audiences.
* Bachelor’s degree in a related field (computer science, mathematics, marketing analytics, statistics, economics)
* Must have legal right to work in the United States.

**How We Get Things Done…**


This last bit is probably the most important! Here at WBD, our guiding principles are the core values by which we operate and are central to how we get things done. You can find them at www.wbd.com/guiding-principles/ along with some insights from the team on what they mean and how they show up in their day to day. We hope they resonate with you and look forward to discussing them during your interview.

**Championing Inclusion at WBD**


Warner Bros. Discovery embraces the opportunity to build a workforce that reflects the diversity of our society and the world around us. Being an equal opportunity employer means that we take seriously our responsibility to consider qualified candidates on the basis of merit, without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, mental or physical disability, and genetic information, marital status, citizenship status, military status, protected veteran status or any other category protected by law.
If you’re a qualified candidate and you require adjustments or accommodations to search for a job opening or apply for a position, please contact us at recruitadmin@wbd.com.
In compliance with local law, we are disclosing the compensation, or a range thereof, for roles in locations where legally required. Actual salaries will vary based on several factors, including but not limited to external market data, internal equity, location, skill set, experience, and/or performance. Base pay is just one component of Warner Bros. Discovery’s total compensation package for employees. Pay Range: $105,901.00 - $196,672.00 salary per year. Other rewards may include annual bonuses, short- and long-term incentives, and program-specific awards. In addition, Warner Bros. Discovery provides a variety of benefits to employees, including health insurance coverage, an employee wellness program, life and disability insurance, a retirement savings plan, paid holidays and sick time and vacation.

title: Pet Vet Ambassador
description:
**Job Summary:**

***This job requires at least 1 year of veterinary experience.***  
PetVet Dx has an exciting opportunity for a Pet Vet Ambassador (PVA) to join our team! The PVA is responsible for: effectively educating potential clients on our proprietary molecular diagnostic testing platform, properly collecting samples, delivering our robust product line, and growing our clients through service and direct sales. By communicating our tools and resources and selling the benefits of the solutions we provide, the PVA will help our partners’ animal healthcare grow. The PVA will provide commercial products to clinicians, department personnel, purchasing department and inventory managers within assigned territory however the PVA primarily provides direct sales and services to Veterinarian Colleges. This position requires regular travel within the assigned territory as well as occasional overnight travel ensuring collection of tests to be sent directly to the lab or delivered to a specific laboratory. The territory for this position will be based in New Orleans, LA and surrounding key accounts.

**Duties:**  
Sample Collection and Analysis:

* Responsible for collecting samples and submitting them for analysis
* Ensure sample requisition forms are completed properly and samples are in the appropriate containers
* Log each form and take ownership of proper reporting
* Update all relevant customer account information on a weekly basis

Customer Relationship Support:

* Perform in-services, training and implementation with pertinent personnel and veterinarian staff
* Effectively insulate accounts against competition utilizing the benefits of advanced real-time Polymerase Chain Reaction (PCR) Testing
* Build a strong sales relationship by cold calling and establishing relationships with Veterinarian Institutions that will provide ongoing revenue goal achievement
* Promote and educate clients on a variety of current and new products
* Report any complaints or concerns from facilities to the designated authorities

Product Sales and Growth:

* Successfully build and execute a monthly business plan with quarterly updates in alignment with our service and sales process
* Achieve individual sales revenue quota weekly to be reviewed quarterly and annually
* Effectively and successfully service/sell cross departmentally within a veterinarian school and affiliates including regional labs and veterinary internal labs by articulating our value-based solutions to targeted customers, affiliates, and prospects
* Demonstrate public speaking skills and an ability to effectively present to small and medium sized groups

Team Member Contribution:

* Exerts initiative and drive to improve departmental and organizational operations
* Identifies problems, creates solutions, and maintains personal accountability for results
* Pursues the designated knowledge and/or experience with a positive attitude
* Completes assigned tasks with excellence and in a timely manner
* Integrates successfully into team environment by partnering Service/Sales and efforts with other PVA’s and internal support team

**Qualifications:**

* Prior experience within Veterinarian field required
* Prior Veterinary Technician Training (Certificate or License) is strongly preferred
* Science background highly desired with three or four years of college experience or graduate work to enter Veterinarian field
* Strong customer service skills and sales skills such as persuasiveness, influence and closing skills are a must
* Ability to understand and articulate complex scientific literature and use extensive and complex clinical data as a key factor in the sales process
* Must have valid driver's license and reliable transportation
* Demonstrated track record with strong academic aptitude
* Excellent time management skills and the ability to anticipate and prioritize work with minimal direction

This is a part-time position working three to four hours, five days a week. Base pay plus commissions will be provided. Occasional overnight travel may be necessary to perform essential job functions.

This job description outlines the primary responsibilities of an Ambassador within our organization. Duties may evolve based on operational needs. We are committed to providing a supportive work environment that values teamwork, professionalism, and dedication to animal welfare. Join us in making a difference in the lives of animals under our care.

Job Types: Part-time, Contract, Internship

Pay: $15.00 - $18.00 per hour

Expected hours: 15 – 30 per week

Schedule:

* After school
* Choose your own hours
* Monday to Friday
* Weekends as needed

Supplemental Pay:

* Commission pay

Work Location: In person

title: Superintendent
description:
*This is a great opportunity for a Handyman looking to advance their career and become a superintendent .* 

**Overview** 

Rose Associates is your gateway to an exhilarating realm of real estate innovation. Our dynamic services platform spans development, management, leasing, and marketing, catering to private and institutional property owners globally. In the unparalleled market of New York City, where unique needs and challenges abound, we've solidified our position as the go-to industry leader.

Established in 1925, Rose Associates boasts almost a century of New York real estate expertise, continuously expanding across the tri-state area. Join us on the forefront of innovation and growth – Rose Associates is where excitement meets opportunity!

Embark on a rewarding career as a Superintendent, contributing significantly to the daily operations of a residential rental community. In this role, you will play a key part in overseeing the building services team, ensuring top-notch staff performance, resident satisfaction, and financial success. You will demonstrate leadership, exceptional customer service, problem-solving skills, decisive decision-making, multitasking abilities, clear communication, knowledge of building mechanical infrastructure, and strong organizational skills.

**Essential Job Functions** 

* Manage day-to-day property maintenance with a focus on addressing tenant and client concerns promptly.
* Coordinate preventive maintenance work, ensure readiness of mechanical equipment, and optimize asset performance.
* Ensure properties pass audits and inspections, remaining compliant with local laws and national codes.
* Complete maintenance and repair activities, including obtaining quotes, scheduling work, and reviewing completed tasks.
* Collaborate with external contractors and vendors, negotiate service contracts, and ensure quality and safety standards.
* Assist in developing and managing the building maintenance budget, reviewing variances, and controlling expenditures.
* Respond to building emergencies, supervise construction projects, and enforce safety protocols.
* Conduct safety inspections and provide necessary training for a safe work environment.
* Investigate and report workplace accidents or incidents, maintaining accurate records and preparing reports for management.
* Lead, train, mentor, and evaluate a team of building staff.
* Administer disciplinary actions and maintain a productive working environment.
* Approve weekly payroll and collaborate with unions and union representatives.
* Able to remain stationary for extended periods of time, up to 50% of the work day
* Ability to move about the building(s) for meetings with tenants, vendors and staff
* Ascend / descend stairs and ladders, as well as positions oneself in small spaces for building inspections and maintenance
* Effectively communicate with tenants, vendors, staff and various departments within the company
* Recognize areas for improvement, detect issues and assess the best plan of action to rectify them
* Transport large or heavy objects (up to 50 lbs) throughout the property
* Exposure to a variety of environments to include varying weather conditions

**Qualifications** 

* A minimum of 4 years of experience in maintenance.
* Ability to implement sustainable energy practices and grid interactive maintenance procedures.
* Knowledge of building mechanical systems, including plumbing, electrical, carpentry, waterproofing, and HVAC.
* Proficiency in effective communication with staff, property management teams, and senior management.
* Required licenses and certificates (Certificate of fitness S12, Certificate of fitness S-13, Certificate of fitness S-95, Certificate of fitness P-99, EPA 608 Universal).
* Availability to respond to emergencies and be on call 24 hours.
* Strong self-management, prioritization skills, and a professional demeanor.
* Practical experience with modern motion detection and video capture technologies.
* Proficiency with computers and property management software, including Microsoft Office and Yardi.
* Must be able to reside on site.
* Work authorization (required).

Rose Associates requires all colleagues to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 unless there is an approved religious or medical exemption.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $20.00 per hour

Expected hours: No less than 40 per week

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday
* On call

Application Question(s):

* Will you now or in the future require sponsorship to work in the United States?
* Are you fully vaccinated against COVID-19?
* What is your desired base salary?
* Are you able to reside on site in a studio apartment?

Work Location: In person

New York, NY 10016

title: instrumentation controls technician
description:
Job Summary:

We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Instrumentation technician to join our team. The successful candidate will be responsible for ensuring the safe and efficient operation of our industrial equipment and systems. This role involves hands-on maintenance, troubleshooting, and calibration of various instruments and equipment. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in industrial maintenance, a deep understanding of electrical and mechanical systems, and the ability to work safely at high voltages.

Responsibilities:

- Perform routine and preventative maintenance on industrial instruments and equipment, including calibrating and testing to ensure accuracy and reliability.  
- Troubleshoot and repair electrical and mechanical systems, including logic controllers and other control systems.  
- Conduct field service visits to diagnose and repair equipment issues in a timely and cost-effective manner.  
- Use advanced diagnostic tools and techniques to detect and isolate problems.  
- Collaborate with other technicians and engineers to resolve complex issues.  
- Maintain accurate records of maintenance and repair activities.  
- Stay up-to-date with industry developments and best practices related to industrial maintenance and instrument technology.  
- Work safely at high voltages and adhere to all safety protocols and regulations.

Qualifications:

- Associate's degree or equivalent experience in industrial maintenance or a related field.  
- Proven experience in industrial maintenance, with a focus on electrical and mechanical systems.  
- Strong knowledge of electrical and mechanical principles, including high voltage systems.  
- Experience with logic controllers and other control systems.  
- Ability to calibrate and test instruments and equipment.  
- Experience with field service and troubleshooting.  
- Familiarity with industrial instrument technologies.

- Experience in instrument installation, valve calculations, sizing calculations, relief and control valves, motor controls, controls wiring

* instrument installation, motor controls, controls wiring: 5 years (Required)

title: HR Generalist - Director of Administrative Services/Payroll
description:
Looking for a career where you can make a difference in someone else’s life? Where opportunities abound to advance your future, both personally and professionally? The Bristal Assisted Living is the place for you. You’ll thrive in a premier senior care organization that values you as an individual — not just your experience and skillsets, but your unique talents and energy. You’ll enrich the community in which you work, and that community will enrich you. We call what we do at The Bristal “hospitality with a higher purpose.” We know you’ll make an impactful difference. Because the difference is you. *Come join us!*

***HR Generalist*** 

We are seeking an experienced, friendly, customer-service-oriented **Director of Administrative Services/ Payroll/HR** professional with a strong background in HR and payroll processingto serve at our beautiful and luxurious community. The ideal candidate will possess exceptional Human Resource, clerical, organizational, and payroll skills in general and, in particular, have excellent people skills. The Director of Administrative Services provides a wide range of Human Resources and Business Office support to management and staff of the assisted living community. Offers advisement and oversight in conjunction with the Executive Director on Employee Recruitment, Progressive Discipline, Performance Management, and Employee Relations matters while facilitating positive relationships between Directors and Employees. Supervises the concierge/reception staff, ensuring proper training, coverage, management of performance and compliance with company expectations. Administers the life cycle of an employee from new hire to separation of employment to include employee benefits support, payroll and data control. Has an overall knowledge and strong understanding of community policies and practices in order to best support the Executive Director within the Community.

**Additional responsibilities include:** *HR Generalist* 

* Coaches Directors on Human Resources best practices and all policies surrounding
* Community level Recruitment, Performance Management, Learning and Development, and Progressive Discipline to promote a culture of continuous growth, team building, and development of employees.
* Maintains current knowledge of system wide and location specific procedures, processes, policies, and operations while enforcing these policies throughout the community in concert with the Department Directors.
* Perform full life cycle of new hire process, ensuring complete and accurate completion of new hire forms to foster a successful onboarding.
* Performs new hire orientation, to include all requisite paperwork, while ensuring all new hires attend orientation. Assists and/or delivers mandatory in-services on other topics.
* Perform all required functions of NYS Criminal History Record Check (CHRC), and non-CHRC Background processes in a complete and timely manner.
* Coordinate, promote, and explain health and welfare benefit programs.
* Manage the Employee of the Month program.
* Ensure employee workers’ compensation incident reports are fully completed by supervisor and employee. Maintain appropriate follow up with staff member and insurance carrier to keep claim exposure to a minimum.
* Maintain OSHA logs, submit required OSHA annual online reporting and ensure all federal and state required postings are posted and current.
* Explain procedures to employees requiring leave ensuring all paperwork is sent out, completed, leaves are tracked, and return to work is facilitated according to various laws.
* As Health Commerce System (HCS) Coordinator, keep role assignments up-to-date.
* Maintains records of staff licensing and certifications, validates licenses/certificates of new hires prior to date of hire. Sends necessary reminders prior to expiration date of licensure/certificate.

**Full-time schedule requires working one weekend day per week (Sun-Thurs 9am-5:30pm).**

**Qualifications:**

* Minimum of five years of in-depth experience within Human Resources including Payroll
* 2 years’ experience in a healthcare office environment preferred.
* Minimum of two years of staff supervision, strongly preferred.
* Bachelor’s degree in a related field or equivalent related experience.
* Strong customer service mentality
* Flexible with time
* Able to interact in a positive and productive manner with a variety of people, employees as well as residents and families and outside individuals.
* Proficient in MS Windows, Outlook, Excel and Microsoft Word.
* Accurate and detail oriented and have the ability to refocus attention as the day demands, understanding there will be many interruptions.
* Must be confidential with employee and resident information
* Knowledge of general office equipment.
* Ability to work under pressure, meet deadlines, be exacting in performance
* Work well in an environment with minimal supervision by creating own deadlines and work schedules
* Communicate clearly in English and speak effectively in front of a group

**Benefits include:** *HR Generalist* 

* Salary increases based on annual performance
* Annual team appreciation events, quarterly team appreciation bonuses and an annual holiday bonus
* 401K plan
* AFLAC Benefits
* Company paid life insurance policy
* PTO days, company paid holidays, with a PTO cash-out option annually
* Optional lunch for all employees
* Available health, dental and vision coverage
* $6,000 tuition reimbursement per year for the LPN to RN Bridge Program

title: Gym Receptionist
description:
A **gym receptionist** plays a crucial role in ensuring the smooth operation of a fitness facility.

***The current Shift we are looking to Fill starts at 3:30pm, Monday through Friday***

**Job Summary:**

The Gym Receptionist is responsible for providing excellent customer service and administrative support to members and guests at the gym. They are the first point of contact for visitors and play a key role in maintaining a positive gym experience.

**Key Responsibilities:**

1. Customer Service: Greet members and guests with a friendly and welcoming attitude, addressing inquiries, and providing information about gym services, classes, and membership options.

2. Check-In: Ensure efficient member check-in and check-out processes, verifying membership cards or payment details as necessary.

3. Phone and Email Handling: Answer phones professionally, assisting with appointment scheduling, class reservations, and general inquiries.

4. Membership Sales: Promote and sell gym memberships, providing details on benefits and pricing options.

5. Administrative Tasks: Assist in administrative duties such as data entry, filing, and maintaining member records and attendance logs.

6. Payment Processing: Handle credit card transactions, and payment reconciliations accurately.

7. Safety and Security: Monitor access to the gym, ensuring only authorized individuals enter the premises. Address security concerns promptly.

8. Cleaning and Organization: Maintain the cleanliness and organization of the front desk area, including keeping brochures and promotional materials well-stocked.

9. Conflict Resolution: Handle member concerns or complaints professionally and seek solutions to ensure member satisfaction.

**Qualifications:**

- High school diploma or equivalent.

- Excellent interpersonal and communication skills.

- Strong customer service orientation.

- Basic computer skills for data entry and software usage.

- Knowledge of gym facilities, services, and fitness classes are a plus.

- Ability to maintain a neat and professional appearance.

A gym receptionist plays a vital role in creating a positive and welcoming atmosphere for gym members and visitors, contributing to the overall success of the fitness facility.

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

Pay: From $15.13 per hour

Expected hours: No less than 35 per week

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Evening shift
* Monday to Friday

title: Commercial Counsel
description:
Job Title
Commercial Counsel
Job Description
About The Position
The Commercial Counsel will be a key member of Dotdash Meredith’s legal team and have primary responsibility for managing and modernizing our process for sales and other commercial contract review and negotiation. These contracts are key to the business and require attention to detail, problem-solving and efficiency. This role requires a strong understanding of IP law and contracts, strong organizational and communication skills, and the ability to work cross-functionally with non-lawyers. The ideal candidate has 3+ years of major law firm experience in IP transactions as well as some operational business experience.
About The Team:
We are small, nimble, and value entrepreneurial mindsets and professionalism.
About The Positions Contributions:
Weight *%*
Accountabilities, Actions and Expected Measurable Results
50%
 Draft, review, and negotiate commercial contracts, and supervise paralegal review of certain contracts.
20%
 Support the design, establishment, and maintenance of an efficient process for quick turns of contracts.
30%
 Communicate with internal clients and team members, including by developing and leading trainings on Dotdash Meredith’s contracting process and key legal issues.
The Role’s Minimum Qualifications and Job Requirements
Education:
Juris Doctor
Undergraduate degree
Experience:
Admitted to the bar of NY or IA.
3-5 + years of experience in commercial work at a nationally-recognized law firm.
Strong familiarity with IP law.
Additional Preferred Experience:
1+ years of operational business experience (either as in-house counsel or in a non-legal role)
Specific experience with IP transactions.
Specific Knowledge, Skills, Certifications and Abilities:* The ability to work collaboratively and to engage and influence in a matrix organization.
* Strong interpersonal and influencing skills which can be applied to both internal and external relationships, with the ability to reconcile compliance requirements with business needs as far as is possible.
* Sound and balanced legal judgment and business awareness, with an appropriate understanding of the need to pragmatically assess risk
* Excellent written and oral communication skills. Adept at analyzing and interpreting laws and regulations. Attention to detail.

title: Porter
description:
**Overview:**

Rose Associates is your gateway to an exhilarating realm of real estate innovation. Our dynamic services platform spans development, management, leasing, and marketing, catering to private and institutional property owners globally. In the unparalleled market of New York City, where unique needs and challenges abound, we've solidified our position as the go-to industry leader.

Established in 1925, Rose Associates boasts almost a century of New York real estate expertise, continuously expanding across the tri-state area. Join us on the forefront of innovation and growth – Rose Associates is where excitement meets opportunity!

We are seeking a highly motivated and customer-focused Residential Property Porter to join our vibrant team and contribute to the overall satisfaction and well-being of our residents.

**Essential Functions:**

* Maintain the property’s aesthetic appeal and perform routine tasks on a daily, weekly, and monthly basis, encompassing activities such as vacuuming, cleaning, and meticulously detailing common areas, including hallways, lobbies, and recreation spaces, outdoor grounds and landscaping clean and well-maintained.
* Assist in snow and ice removal during inclement weather and put out / remove rain mats to ensure safe pathways for residents.
* Collect and dispose of trash from common areas and ensure proper recycling procedures are followed.
* Work closely with maintenance staff to address minor repairs, painting, water intrusion cleanup, minor damage and other related service requests.
* Clean out vacant units to prepare for apartment turns.
* Provide excellent customer service to residents, responding to inquiries and addressing concerns in a timely and professional manner, and cover front desk / concierge staff and deliver packages to tenants as necessary.
* Comply with workplace safety and OSHA regulations.
* Must be present on-site and be able to move throughout the building to address building related matters and meet with tenants, staff, vendors and visitors.
* Ability to ascend and descend stairs, as well as positioning oneself in small spaces for building inspections and maintenance repairs and lifting and moving large or heavy objects in excess of 50 pounds.
* Must be comfortable with exposure to varying environmental climates and circumstances.

**Qualifications:**

* High School diploma or equivalent and / or previous experience in a similar role is preferred.
* Ability to operate and maintain landscaping and maintenance equipment.
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
* Must be able to work a flexible schedule to include days, nights, weekends, holidays.

Rose Associates requires all colleagues to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 unless there is an approved religious or medical exemption.

title: Manager, Social Media Comm Mgmt
description:
Job Description Summary:
We are seeking a talented and strategic Social Media Manager to lead organic social media channels for KISS Products. In this role, you’ll manage content calendars, support product launches, track social media trends, oversee community management, and report on performance metrics. You will lead a team, including the Social Media/Community Manager for Falscara, and collaborate with external agencies on content creation and community engagement. This position works closely with brand marketing teams and reports to the Director of Lash Marketing. The ideal candidate is social media-obsessed, with a passion for content creation and excellent writing skills. They should be a strong communicator who thrives in fast-paced environments.
Job Description:
Key Responsibilities* Develop and execute social media strategies for KISS Products.
* Manage the social content calendar, supporting launches, promotions, and organic content creation.
* Collaborate with marketing, creative, sales, and e-commerce teams to create and deploy content.
* Partner with creative teams to develop assets for product launches and social holidays.
* Coordinate with external agencies for content creation and community management efforts.
* Oversee community management across social platforms for KISS products using Dash Hudson and natively in apps.
* Cultivate brand loyalty by driving engagement, managing influencer partnerships, hosting giveaways, and addressing customer inquiries.
* Write and review copy for social channels in collaboration with the copy and brand teams.
* Monitor product feedback, track brand sentiment, analyze KPIs, and keep an eye on competitor activity.
* Manage invoices and establish KPIs to measure social media performance.
* Boost Instagram posts and initiate TikTok content to enhance engagement.
* Oversee the Social Media/Community Manager for Falscara.
* Stay up to date with social media trends, bringing fresh ideas and innovative approaches to the team.


Requirements* Bachelor’s degree in Journalism, Marketing, Communications, or Advertising
* 5+ years of experience in social media management (preferably within the beauty industry)
* 3+ years of experience managing teams/team members
* Proven copywriting skills with relevant writing samples
* Expertise in TikTok, Instagram, Facebook content trends, and community management
* Strong project management, problem-solving, and communication abilities
* Ability to prioritize tasks effectively in a fast-paced environment

title: Construction and Facilities Business Controller
description:
**Company Description**  

At H&M, our purpose is to liberate fashion for the many. We want to shape a new world in Fashion. A world with one ultimate goal: to unleash your self-expression. As an H&M colleague, you’re encouraged to be yourself & more. You’ll take on new responsibilities from day one, learn skills for life, and find new ways to make your big dreams come true.


Our company is committed to fostering a culture of inclusion and belonging, and we actively seek colleagues who share our commitment.

 **Job Description**  

As a **Construction and Facilities** **Business Controller** in the Expansion function, you are responsible for supporting the Regional Head of Construction & Facilities Manager with setting and implementing the regional strategy for construction and facilities. You set budgeting and follow-up with result, perform trend analysis, prognosis, and reporting. You are responsible for risk management, driving improvements and actions in processes, methods and tools and leading your team. You support all markets and brands within the region.


This hybrid role reports to our Expansion Controlling Manager and is based out of New York, NY.

**A Day in the Life**


Working at H&M means no two days are ever the same, but a typical day will include the following responsibilities\\*

* Support Regional Head of Construction and Facilities to develop, maintain and improve the regional C&F strategy
* Together with Head of Expansion Controlling, develop, maintain and improve the regional controlling strategy
* Set short- and long-term goals and targets for countries within the region
* Effectively collaborate with stakeholders and countries within the region to secure alignment in ways of working
* Create and maintain strategy and tools for budgeting processes within the region
* Utilize Service Channel analytics to secure needed reports, analysis to support your team as well as the C&F teams in the Sales Markets
* Follow-up on budget accuracy and constantly improve the way of working in this field. Trend analysis, prognosis and reporting
* Act as a finance business partner to the C&F organization in your region to identify opportunities to optimize requirements, improve the balance between cost and quality
* Develop and implement methods and systems to increase efficiency and decrease costs
* Manage and monitor the financial control systems of the construction and facilities department
* Ensure cost follow up supports sales market C&F Managers to have the full picture of the total Construction & Facilities cost including CAPEX, OPEX, reactive and scheduled costs, FM20s and SP10s
* Proactively analyze and evaluate department and function performance versus set short- and long-term goals
* Prepare and communicate monthly and quarterly reporting packages
* Work according to the general guidelines to ensure routines and drive improvements/actions in processes, methods, and tools to minimize business risks
* Secure the financial transparency on the highest level and that each team member is aware of its responsibilities and approval rights
* Create conditions to enable performance of teams and individuals
* and develop talents in order to build (future) organization and diverse teams
* Strengthen teamwork and foster collaboration
* Required Domestic and International travel at least 5% of the time

  

**Qualifications** **Who You Are:**

* Degree in business administration or engineering
* Knowledge about common accounting principles
* Advanced level in Power BI, MS Teams, SharePoint, Excel, PowerPoint
* Oral and written proficiency in English
* At least 3 years of relevant working experience
* Experience working in controlling, preferably within the retail sector
* Experience with preparing and presenting financial reporting to Senior Management and other stakeholders.
* Communicative / consultative
* Analytical / methodical
* Resilient / achievement oriented
* Inclusive, positive, open to feedback, willing to multitask and learn on the job

 **Additional Information** **Why You’ll Love Working at H&M**

* We value diverse backgrounds, including but not limited to race, ethnicity, gender, age, religion, sexual orientation, and disability
* We pride ourselves on being a values-driven organization, guided by our 7 unique values that have been part of our success story for over 75 years
* You’ll have access to our Colleague Resource Groups (CRGs) to find community and networking opportunities among colleagues
* We are an inclusive company where you’re encouraged to be yourself at work
* You will have access to a large global talent community, where career growth and aspirations have no limits
* We believe in supporting your overall wellbeing and offer comprehensive benefits inclusive of health insurance, wellness and family support programs, company match 401k, paid leave programs, and paid time off, including a community day to serve your local community
* You’ll be able to express your personal style with our employee discount at H&M, & Other Stories, and COS

  

Compensation: salary range is $125,822-$144,699 annually\\*\\*

* This job posting highlights the most critical responsibilities and requirements of the job and is not all-inclusive. There may be additional duties, and responsibilities assigned for this job at the company’s discretion.


\\*\\*H&M, in good faith, has assessed this posted range of compensation as the accurate range for this role and location at the time of this posting. H&M may ultimately pay more or less than the posted range depending on candidate qualifications. This range may be modified in the future.


EEOC Code: OFM

**Reports to:** Accounting Manager  
**Pay Range:** $60,000 to $70,000 annually

**Job Summary:**

Valor PayTech is a rapidly growing FinTech company offering innovative, advanced, and secure all-in-one payment technology solutions for ISOs, merchants, and new business owners. We are currently looking for a JR Accountant to join the team.

The Junior Accountant is responsible for supporting the accounting department by performing various financial tasks. The Junior Accountant will assist with day-to-day accounting activities, including data entry, account reconciliation, and financial reporting.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* **Data Entry and Record Keeping:**
* Enter financial transactions into accounting software accurately and promptly.
* Maintain and organize accurate records of all financial transactions, ensuring proper documentation.
* **Account Reconciliation:**
* Assist in reconciling bank statements, credit card accounts, and general ledger accounts.
* Investigate discrepancies and help resolve issues during the reconciliation process.
* **Accounts Payable and Receivable:**
* Process invoices, match them to purchase orders, and ensure proper coding.
* Assist in preparing accounts payable checks and ensuring timely payments.
* Help with accounts receivable tasks, including invoicing customers and following up on outstanding payments.
* **Financial Reporting:**
* Support the preparation of monthly, quarterly, and annual financial reports.
* Assist in preparing balance sheets, income statements, and other financial documents as needed.
* **Assisting with Audits:**
* Help gather documentation and support the accounting team during internal and external audits.
* Ensure accurate and timely provision of requested information.
* **Expense Reporting:**
* Review and process employee expense reports, ensuring compliance with company policies.
* Verify receipts and documentation before processing reimbursements.
* **General Support:**
* Provide administrative support to the accounting department as needed.
* Assist with special projects and tasks as assigned by the Senior Accountant or Accounting Manager.

**Qualifications:**

* **Education:**
* Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related field (preferred).
* Relevant coursework or internships in accounting are a plus.
* **Experience:**
* 3-5 years of experience in accounting or finance (internships or entry-level experience preferred).
* Familiarity with accounting software such as QuickBooks, SAP, or Oracle is a plus.
* **Skills:**
* Basic understanding of accounting principles and practices.
* Strong attention to detail and organizational skills.
* Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and other Microsoft Office applications.
* Ability to work both independently and as part of a team.
* Good written and verbal communication skills.
* Ability to manage multiple tasks and meet deadlines.

The First Month is training and will take place at 3636 33rd Street , Astoria . NY 11106. After that the position is onsite in Jericho, NY with potentially one trip a month to Astoria for a meeting.

title: Domestic Violence Program - Social Worker Level II, MPA Behavioral Health *Grant Funded*
description:
About NYC Health + Hospitals

**Empower Every New Yorker — Without Exception — to Live the Healthiest Life Possible**

NYC Health + Hospitals is the largest public health care system in the United States. We provide essential outpatient, inpatient and home-based services to more than one million New Yorkers every year across the city’s five boroughs. Our large health system consists of ambulatory centers, acute care centers, post-acute care/long-term care, rehabilitation programs, Home Care, and Correctional Health Services. Our diverse workforce is uniquely focused on empowering New Yorkers, without exception, to live the healthiest life possible.

At NYC Health + Hospitals, our mission is to deliver high quality care health services, without exception. Every employee takes a person-centered approach that exemplifies the ICARE values (Integrity, Compassion, Accountability, Respect, and Excellence) through empathic communication and partnerships between all persons.

Job Description

Under general supervision, with moderate latitude for the exercise of independent judgment, in addition to performing the typical tasks described in Assignment Level I above, performs the following typical tasks:

The Social Worker provides client evaluation and social work services to DV Shelter clients. They will support shelter caseworkers and social workers in the screening, assessment and referral of clients for clinical mental health services provided by Heath and Hospital. Social Worker II-IV may provide and coordinate services at shelter designated locations, the Family Justice Center, or via Tele-Health.

* Provide adult, children, and group socio-psychotherapy including crisis and grief counseling at required level to those impacted by IPV and referred to care.
* Coordinate care for clients after assessments with DV shelter and H+H clinical team.
* Collaborate with center staff and on-site service agencies related to clients’ clinical needs. Assist in facilitating referral for psychiatric care when appropriate.
* Perform administrative duties including documenting care metrics to ensure we are meeting Central Office targets.
* Responsible for monitor all patients in case load from referral to intake to post-referral treatment to ensure good patient care.
* Present intake data at weekly clinical meeting.
* Maintains and competes statistics of case activities as outlined or requested by Director.
* Ensures patient records are stored securely, confidentially, and compliant with HIPAA standards. Interfaces with hospital Medical Records department as necessary.
* Attend all trainings and departmental meeting as requested.
* In the temporary absence of the supervisor may perform duties if requested by Director.

Minimum Qualifications

For Assignment to Level II  
1. Valid license as an LMSW issued by the NYSED; or  
2. Valid license as an LCSW issued by the NYSED.

Department Preferences

* Supports and trains caseworkers and DV social workers
* Develops instructional materials and techniques
* Experience with Domestic Violence and/or trauma population. Strong interpersonal and communication skills and ability to work well in a multidisciplinary team setting. Familiarity with high-risk patients and cultural sensitivity in community settings. Familiarity with high-risk populations and community settings, demonstrated interest in maternal mental health. Administrative and research experience a plus. Child treatment also plus.
* Two (2) years’ experience in a Hospital setting, preferably in Behavioral Health Services
* Bilingual Spanish preferred. Other languages a plus.
* Two years background at responsible management and administrative levels; or, An equivalent combination of training, educational background and experience in related fields and educational disciplines; and
* General knowledge of policies and programs utilized in the operation of a health care facility, ability to assimilate and analyze data, to recommend action based on analytical findings, and to assist in the solution of complex problems in health care administration and management.

How To Apply

If you wish to apply for this position, please apply online by clicking the "Apply Now" button.

*If applying online, please include your cover letter in the same file attachment with your uploaded resume.*

NYC Health and Hospitals offers a competitive benefits package that includes:

* Comprehensive Health Benefits for employees hired to work 20+ hrs. per week
* Retirement Savings and Pension Plans
* Loan Forgiveness Programs for eligible employees
* Paid Holidays and Vacation in accordance with employees' Collectively bargained contracts
* College tuition discounts and professional development opportunities
* Multiple employee discounts programs

Pay: $82,400.00 per year

* Dental insurance
* Employee assistance program
* Employee discount
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off

* Day shift

* license as a NYS LMSW issued by the NYSED (Required)

title: Human Resources & Recruitment Internship
description:
Need a Spring 2025 Internship? Apply Now!

USA Sport Group is at the forefront of providing high-quality sports enrichment programs to over 60,000 children annually. With classes and camps taking place in over 400 towns across NY, NJ & CT including preschool sports, soccer, tennis, basketball, t-ball, and more, we are always on the lookout for great people to join our team.

As a USA Sport Group Intern, you will gain hands-on work experience at an exciting, fast-paced, sports company. USA Sport Group internships can provide you with college course credits (depending on school requirements), or simply provide necessary work experience to prepare you for your future career.

The HR & Recruitment Internship is designed for students studying or those aspiring towards a career in human resources, recruitment, human services, employee relations, psychology, business administration and/or labor studies. Students will gain knowledge and experience in the recruitment process, scheduling, organizational development, and employee management.

You will work under the guidance of the Human Resources Director to assist with recruitment, on-boarding, and compliance checks before and during the employment life cycle of employees. You will gain knowledge in the business of high-volume recruitment and will assist with posting employment opportunities on job boards, screening applicants, assessing applicant eligibility, scheduling interviews, and organizing candidate assessments.

Part of your experience will include assisting the Recruitment Manager with the planning and implementation of regional recruitment events, employee development workshops and careers fairs, where you will also gain work experience in event planning and marketing. Other responsibilities will include but are not limited to:

* Create, maintain and monitor the health and status of employee profiles
* Perform background checks, reference screening, and record necessary certifications to meet employment compliance
* Assist in the development and improvement of company policies and procedures
* Provide an open line of communication to candidates
* Assist customers with their registration via phone and live chat

Does this sound like you?

* Excellent interpersonal skills
* Detailed oriented with strong organizational and documentation skills
* Ability to maturely handle sensitive and confidential information
* Ability to deliver company philosophy and uphold customer service standards
* Clear and friendly phone manner
* Computer literate - especially Microsoft Office programs including Excel and Outlook
* Ability to multi-task in a pressurized environment
* Good communication skills both verbally and in written
* An interest or passion for sports
* Currently enrolled in a college institution or relevant experience is preferred

Flexible Internships Available

* Base internship of 15 hours per week
* Internships will be fully onsite in Whitehouse Station, NJ
* Customizable hours based around your studies
* Customizable to earn course credits

Job Type: Internship

Pay: $10.00 per day

Benefits:

* Flexible schedule

Schedule:

* Choose your own hours

title: Assistant Property Manager
description:
Join Rose Associates, where real estate innovation thrives. With nearly a century of expertise, we're a leading force in New York City's dynamic market. Become an Assistant Community Manager and seize the excitement and opportunity within our vibrant residential communities. We are seeking a detail-oriented individuals committed to excellence to support our Property Manager, ensuring the ongoing success of our multifamily properties.

Key Responsibilities:

* Act as a liaison between ownership and residents, ensuring smooth communication by drafting and circulating resident communications.
* Cultivate a welcoming atmosphere by fostering strong relationships among residents, management, and building staff.
* Take charge of lease administration, including meticulous data entry into property management software, managing calendars, and processing codes for accounts payable and receivable.
* Keep office files organized, manage inventory, and ensure compliance with storage, bicycle, and fitness agreements.
* Prepare comprehensive monthly reports, maintaining delinquency below 0.5% of GPR.
* Coordinate Move In/Move Out procedures, handle insurance certificates, and oversee Move Out Reports and security deposit refunds.
* Assist the Resident Manager with post-move out walk-throughs, coordinate vendors, and review contracts.
* Support the Property Manager in budget forecasting, organizing building-related events, and managing emergencies.
* Provide after-hours on-call support when necessary, promptly communicating any issues to the Property Manager.
* Analyze income and expense trends, contribute to budget forecasting, and assist with code processing and filing.
* Collaborate closely with property management on renovations, vendor coordination, and lease enforcement.
* Stay informed about the competitive marketplace, oversee resident retention initiatives, and be prepared to handle emergencies.
* Maintain a physical presence on-site, ensuring effective communication with tenants, staff, vendors, and visitors.
* Comfortably navigate stairs and adapt to varying environmental conditions as needed.
* Flexibility to perform additional duties outside of regular responsibilities as required.

Qualifications:

* Bachelor’s degree in business, marketing, real estate, or finance is preferred.
* Minimum of 3 years of multifamily or assistant property management experience.
* Proficiency in navigating computers and property management software, including Microsoft Office, On-Site, and Yardi.
* Technical knowledge of building operations and maintenance.
* Understanding of marketing trends, budgeting, and reporting.
* Experience with affordable housing.
* Tax credit certification is required, and experience with HDC is preferred.
* Valid NYS real estate license or ability to obtain one within the first 120 days of employment. All active license holders must register their license with Rose Associates upon hire.
* Work authorization (required)
* Must be available to work weekends (Saturdays and Sundays)

In addition to base compensation, significant incentive pay and full benefits packages are available.

Rose Associates requires all colleagues to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 unless there is an approved religious or medical exemption.

title: Facilitated Enroller (Bilingual Encouraged)
company: Health and Welfare Council of Long Island
description:
The Health and Welfare Council of Long Island (HWCLI) is a private, not for profit, health and human services planning, research/public education and advocacy organization that serves as the umbrella for public and non-profit agencies serving Long Island’s poor and vulnerable individuals and families.

HWCLI seeks energetic, passionate, and socially conscious individuals to support HWCLI’s mission by helping the Aged, Blind, and Disabled (ABD) populations learn about health insurance options, identify the best insurance option for them.

**Responsibilities**

* Educate potential clients about the aged, blind, and disabled (ABD) program and medical assistance programs such as Medicaid and Medicare Savings Program (MSP) that may be available to them under the Local DSS in Nassau and Suffolk County.
* Assist enrollees in completing the Medicaid and MSP application/ re-certification application by collecting applicable documents needed and by entering appropriate data on the application.
* Accurately complete and submit application for the Aged, Blind and Disabled population to local DSS in Nassau and Suffolk County.
* Maintain all records to ensure confidentiality, privacy, and security requirements.
* Complete all necessary training, retraining and comply with certification requirements of the Aged, Blind, and Disabled program.
* Attend any regularly scheduled meetings/webinars for program information, updates, ongoing training, and technical support.
* Perform any other duties that are relevant to achieving the goals of the agency.
* Assist Managers and Senior Staff on healthcare projects, as needed.
* Collaborate with the Healthcare Access team on client engagement, application troubleshooting, enrollment specifications and advocacy.
* Conduct community outreach to potential enrollees, community partners and attend outreach events throughout Long Island
* Travel throughout Long Island is required.

**Qualifications, Required Skills, and Experience**

* Strong commitment to social justice and HWCLI’s mission.
* Demonstrated background in client-facing public service positions.
* Strong commitment to collaboration; self-starter
* Strong communication and client service skills.
* Comfortability with in-depth research to find solutions and referral opportunities for complex client needs.
* Basic knowledge of Microsoft Office and usage of online platforms.
* Flexibility to comfortably interchange between detailed client service, research, outreach, and data collection.
* Excellent organizational skills, including ability to pay close attention to details.
* Bilingual strongly preferred.
* NYS license and access to a car is a MUST.
* HS Diploma or GED required; Associate/bachelor’s degree in human services or related field strongly preferred.

**Benefits & Salary**

* Compensation is commensurate with experience.
* Retirement plan, flexible spending accounts, paid time-off.
* Opportunity to work in a dynamic environment making a positive impact in our region.
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

SALARY range: $47,000 – based on experience.

* 8-hour shift
* Monday to Friday
* Occasionally on weekends

People with a criminal record are encouraged to apply.

title: OPERATIONS ASSISTANT MANAGER
description:
Store Dollar Tree  


Work where you love to shop! Dollar Tree is hiring in your neighborhood. Avoid long commutes and set your own course to success by applying today.  

  

We offer generous benefits, flexible work schedules and the ability to work today and get paid tomorrow.  

  

Responsible for assisting with all operational tasks within the store as delegated and assigned by the Store Manager with main focus on the front-end and sales floor operations. Also assist with the hiring, training and development of store associates as delegated by the Store Manager  

  

**Principal Duties and Responsibilities**  

* Assist with all store functions and day-to-day store activities as directed by the Store Manager
* Able to perform all opening and closing procedures in the absence of the Store Manager
* Assist the Store Manager in protecting and securing all company assets, including store cash
* Adhere to all policies and procedures including safety guidelines
* Maintain a professional and friendly environment with customers, subordinates and supervisors
* Maintain all areas of the store, including the stockroom and sales floor, to company standards to include recovery
* When the Store Manager is not on the premises, direct supervisory responsibility for all hourly Associates
* Process all SSC Corporate directives including Pull and Hold/Destroy, Task Compliance, Key Survey information
* requests and any additional communications related to store activities as delegated by the Store Manager
* Assist the Store Manager on the receipt and return of DSD merchandise.
	+ Follow the VIP and DSD Policies and Procedures
* Assist the Store Manager in ensuring proper staffing coverage on a daily basis
* Assist the Store Manager in ensuring that the sales floor is sales effective on a daily basis
* Assist in the management of cashiering activities to ensure all company cash handling practices & guidelines are followed at all times by all Associates
* Promotional effectiveness of store-front fixtures and displays
* Assist in the management of sales effectiveness of seasonal areas in the store
* Coordinate appropriate signage utilized in the store
* Assist with the receipt and return of DSD merchandise
* Process damaged merchandise on a daily basis
* Assist Store Manager with creation of weekly schedules
* Assist in the management of store supplies and expense control
* Assist with merchandising and maintaining the checkout area to maximize impulse sales
* Ensure coolers and store-front program racks/displays are refilled daily (balloon program, sunglasses, batteries, etc.)

  

**Minimum Requirements/Qualifications**  

* Prefer prior retail and management experience
* Strong communication, interpersonal, and written skills
* Ability to lift, bend and transport merchandise weighing up to 50lbs
* Ability to work in a high energy team environment

  

We value our Associates' contributions to our success, which drives us to invest in the most important element of our organization: our people.
  

As we work towards a healthier future, we provide eligible associates with the following:  

Health and welfare programs including medical, pharmacy, dental, and vision  

Employee Assistance Program  

Paid Time Off  

Retirement Plans  

Employee Stock Purchase Program  

  

*This job specification should not be construed to imply that these requirements are the exclusive standards of the position. This is not to be considered a complete list of job duties, which appear in the job description for this position, and which may be amended from time to time at the discretion of Dollar Tree. Incumbents will follow any other instructions and perform any other related duties as may be required by their supervisor.*  

  

*Dollar Tree is an equal opportunity employer.*

title: Baker
description:
Hours: 4:00am- 12:30pm

**Job Summary:**  
To deliver a great customer experience while assisting the Bakery Manager in the daily operation of the department with baking, mixing dough, icing, packaging and filling, of designated pastry and bread items in the Bakery Department; to maintain a neat, clean and visually appealing department and to perform other tasks as required in an efficient and safe manner, within Company policy.

**Minimum Required Qualifications:**  
The minimum required qualifications for this position include, but are not limited to the following:

* Ability to proficiently read, write, speak, analyze, interpret, and understand the English language.
* Ability to stand/walk for the duration of a scheduled shift.
* Ability to bend, twist, reach, push, pull and regularly lift 25 lbs., and occasionally lift 50 lbs.
* Ability to work in varying temperatures.
* Ability to work with fresh, dried and/or processed products, spices and powdered substances without negative allergic consequences.
* Ability to tolerate dust and cleaning agents during routine housekeeping duties.
* Ability to interact with Customers in a friendly and helpful way.
* Ability to work cooperatively with others.
* Ability to work all assigned work schedules and comply with all time and attendance policies.

**Essential Job Functions:**  
Performance of the essential functions of this position require the Associate to possess the minimum qualifications listed above. These functions include, but are not limited to, the following:

* Maintain a clean, neat, organized and safe work environment.
* Maintain department sanitation and QA standards (i.e. safety, personal hygiene, clean cases, and equipment).
* Clean and sanitize all work surfaces, utensils and equipment in accordance with Department of Sanitation and QA standards.
* Keep floor clear of debris and spills.
* Greet all Customers and provide them with prompt, courteous service and assistance.
* Maintain and properly use all department equipment as required.
* Pack out product into display cases.
* Rotate product to ensure freshness.
* Ensure accurate signage for the department.
* Prepare trays to Company’s and Customer’s satisfaction.
* Perform all duties in accordance with Local, State and Federal regulations as they pertain to the Bakery operation.
* Dress and groom according to Company policy including uniform, name badge and hat or hair restraint requirements.
* Perform duties in accordance with QA hand washing standards and use disposable gloves when handling food.
* Follow recipes to produce food products of specified flavor, texture, clarity, bouquet, or color.
* Set up, operate, and tend equipment that cooks, mixes, blends or processes ingredients in the production of food products, according to formulas or recipes.
* Rotate all merchandise in accordance with quality assurance standards to ensure freshness.
* Prepare special order requests, as required.
* Track movement of sales on production logs.
* Take a complete & accurate inventory of supplies weekly and re-order supplies and ingredients as needed.
* Place reclamation in its proper location.
* Regularly lift, pull, push and rotate merchandise that weights 25 lbs., and that occasionally weights up to 50 lbs.
* Unload trucks and transport merchandise to Bakery department that weights 25 lbs., and that occasionally weights up to 50 lbs.
* Check prices and be knowledgeable about location of items in the store.
* Promote for sale any current charitable promotions to Customers.
* Stand at work station for duration of scheduled shift, which may exceed 8 hours per day.
* Receive deliveries.
* Assist in other departments when instructed.
* Perform duties in accordance with the Company’s HAZCOM program and adhere to manufacturer’s label instructions for the safe and proper use of all chemical products.
* Perform all duties in accordance with Company rules, policies, safety requirements, and security standards and with all local, state, and federal health and civil code regulations.
* Follow approved procedures for receiving, code dating, preparing, storing, and price marking, arranging, and restocking products to ensure quality, accuracy and product rotation and protection.
* Handle damaged and spoiled products according to Company policy and assist in controlling the level of damaged goods.
* Understand and adhere to Company shrink guidelines as relates to Bakery operations.
* Utilize and maintain equipment as required by department; report any equipment problems immediately.
* Check refrigeration equipment for proper performance regularly; report any failures immediately.
* Complete all applicable department training programs.
* Perform all duties in accordance all Fresh Grocer Service Priorities (Safety, Friendliness, Presentation, and Efficiency).
* Maintain punctual and regular attendance.
* Work overtime as assigned.
* Work cooperatively with others.
* Must be 18 years or older to operate balers, hi-lo’s, power jacks, and slicing machines.
* Perform other duties as assigned.

Job Type: Full-time

Schedule:

* Every weekend
* Monday to Friday
* Morning shift

* Colonia, NJ 07067 (Required)

Ability to Relocate:

* Washington Township, NJ 07676: Relocate before starting work (Required)

title: Residential AutoCAD Drafter
description:
K. Hovnanian is celebrating 60 years of quality and leadership in the home building and community development industry. Do you want to play a large role in those every day decisions that help build dream homes? It’s the homes where people will raise their child, form their most important memories, plot the course for their future, spend quality time with their grandchildren or enjoy quiet times reflecting on a life full of accomplishments. Over 300,000 families have put their dreams in our hands, and you can as well.

From foundations, to façade, to finish, you know all the elements that go into creating quality homes. Beyond industry knowledge, you have a passion for the details that makes ideas work. That’s why you should team with a home construction leader like K. Hovnanian—who cares about the fine points as much as you do! Come create computer-aided plans that will bring our communities to life.

Using premier CAD technology, you’ll draw accurate and detailed plans that help illustrate home plans, building materials, options, etc. You will also develop forms, charts and other construction documents for review by internal decision-makers and future homeowners.

Requirements for this position include a bachelor’s degree in Architecture or an equivalent of a minimum of 2 years' experience in the homebuilding industry. Additional skills include proficiency in AutoCAD Architectural Desktop, Google Sketchup, knowledge of residential construction and structural and mechanical designs.

K. Hovnanian Companies, LLC, a subsidiary of Hovnanian Enterprises, Inc., a well-respected publicly traded company, is committed to providing an environment and programs that help our associates flourish. You can look forward to professional support and extensive benefits—including medical/dental/vision coverage, discounts on mortgages and home appliances, and a 401(k) plan.

**Search Firms Please Read Carefully**:  
K. Hovnanian Companies, LLC is not accepting unsolicited assistance from search firms for this employment opportunity. Please, no phone calls or emails. All resumes submitted by search firms to any associate at K. Hovnanian via email, the Internet or in any form and/or method without a valid written search agreement in place for this position will be deemed the sole property of K. Hovnanian. No fee will be paid in the event the candidate is hired by K. Hovnanian as a result of the referral or through other means.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: From $26.45 per hour

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Experience:

* AutoCAD: 2 years (Preferred)

description:
**\\*Position starts IMMEDIATELY\\***

**POSITIONS NEEDED = 1-2 NEW TEAM MEMBERS**

Hi, I'm Kyle with Simply Yours Concierge. Our company needs dog walking and pet sitting help on weekdays - Monday Tuesday Wednesday Thursday and Friday. 5 days per week - with the MAIN hours of work between 5pm-9pm.

For this role, you must have availability for a consistent, daily dog walking schedule between 5pm-9pm on a daily basis Monday through Friday.

If you have additional open availability in all other hours of the day, this will allow us to get you even more work.

This is to begin immediately. We need the help right away.

Bonus availability if you're free weekends - Saturday day and night, Sunday day and night. Additional hourly flexibility would be super helpful.

This is a commission pay based position - How available you are determines how much work we can provide.

Pay per time/visit: $12 per each 30 minutes. $15 for 45 minutes, $20 for 60 minute visits, $32 for 90 minutes.

There is room to grow, and we're willing to give more jobs and responsibility for a team member who's up for it. As weeks go by, and trust is gained in you, there will be more opportunity to fill your schedule with jobs.

This is a position with potential for lots of dog walks throughout the day - you must be willing to walk a lot.

You must be willing to drive and have reliable transportation - a vehicle.

You MUST BE a PET LOVER. This includes both DOGS and Cats. No EXCUSES. Prior pet care experience REQUIRED.

The Simply Yours Concierge Team

description:
Family is seeking an experienced nanny to provide full-time care starting in mid-November 2024. The nanny will be responsible for ensuring our baby’s well-being, safety, and development through engaging and age-appropriate activities. This role will involve light household tasks related to the baby’s care. The nanny will also be responsible for providing occasional after-school care for our 4-year-old and 7-year-old, and/or daytime care when they are home during school closures.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Provide attentive and loving care to our baby, including feeding, diapering, and dressing.
* Create a stimulating environment through play and activities appropriate for our baby’s age.
* Maintain a consistent daily routine that supports the baby’s sleep and feeding schedule.
* Perform light household duties related to the baby’s care, such as cleaning bottles, baby laundry, and tidying up play areas.
* Ensure a safe and clean environment for the baby at all times.

title: Per Diem Home Infusion
description:
Job description

*Always Compassionate Health is a leading Licensed Home Care Services Agency that provides support services, offering the highest quality of community home-based services, combined with exceptional compassion and innovation to enhance each individuals’s quality of life.*

**We are currently seeking field nurse's (RN) who live in Manhattan with Infusion experience with various infusion therapies, venous accesses, and phlebotomies.**

Nurses are the key pieces of the healthcare services we provide directly to clients. We are looking to hire a Registered Nurse whose direct support, knowledge, skills, and teachings will aid our company to grow, adapt and reach a new platform in home-based nursing services. **This infusion field nurse would be responsible for patient visits to initiate patient care, perform follow-up visits when needed, and precept/evaluate newly hired nurses’ skills RN’s as requested.**

The infusion field nurse will partner with our infusion manager and Intake team to ensure seamless initiation of infusion care in patients’ homes.

**Qualifications:**

* Applicants must have at least three - five years of full-time, or equivalent part-time, experience as a registered nurse in a home care infusion company, hospital, clinic, or medical facility
* Supervisory or managerial experience PREFERRED.
* Infusion experience is REQUIRED.
* Knowledge of principles & practices of supervision, performance evaluation, education
* Knowledge of Federal HIPAA Regulations
* Knowledge of standard nursing policies, procedures, methods, and techniques.
* Ability to read and interpret clinical documents which include physicians’ orders and treatment plans.
* Ability to participate in a multi-disciplinary health care team.

**Job Requirements:**

* NYS Registered Nursing License/Registration
* BLS necessary/ACLS preferred
* Up-to-date medical, inclusive of Physical, 2 PPD’s OR QuantiFERON Gold blood test, or Chest X-Ray
* MMR/Titers Lab Report
* Flu Vaccination (if applicable) or Declination
* 2 forms of government ID
* 2 satisfactory professional references
* Malpractice Insurance
* Reliable vehicle transportation

**Registered Nurse Responsibilities:**

* Comprehensive nursing assessment skills
* PIV, PICC, Central line care and access competence
* Educate patient and/or family in therapy administration via IV
* Infusion therapy preparation and administration
* Patient safety, monitoring, and post infusion follow-up
* Communication with patients, families, infusion pharmacy, medical provider as necessary

A successful infusion field nurse will work collaboratively with the infusion manager, coordinators, and other internal office staff. Performance of on-site field visits to provide patient care and to supervise competence of nursing staff when requested. Ability to multitask and to prioritize work responsibilities and duties – time management skills are essential to the success of this role. Clinical documentation is paperless, so use of a computer and tablet is key.

*Always Compassionate Health provides equal opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, pregnancy, status as a parent, national origin, age, disability (physical or mental), family medical history or genetic information, political affiliation, military service, or any other non-merit based factors protected federal, state, or local law. All employment related decisions are based solely on relevant criteria including experience and suitability. If you require assistance to fill out this application form or during any phase of the job application process, please notify the person who gave you this form or Always Compassionate Health’s Human Resources Department and every reasonable effort will be made to accommodate your needs promptly in accordance with federal, state, and/or local law*
